He would like to buy sacks of corn, rice, nuts, couscous and of beans in order to have a good stock, so he can better meet the constant demand of his customers and avoid being out of stock. He will save his profits, both to grow his business and also to meet his family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of corn, rice, nuts, couscous and beans.

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
Franco es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja como empleado por ocho horas al día y estudia en una de las universidades públicas el resto de su tiempo libre.vive en la zona de Alto Taqcagua de la ciudad de La Paz.

Al ser de familia humilde, Franco da gran parte de su sueldo para colaborar en los gastos del hogar. El crédito lo requiere para pagar un tratamiento dental por un problema de caries muy avanzado y doloroso.

El sueño de Franco es poder ahorrar dinero para tener un negocio propio con lo que pueda ayudar a su familia.

Es la primera vez que es parte de kiva
texts.en: Franco is single living in his parents’ house.  He works as a salaried employee for 8 hours daily and also attends a public university in his free time.  He lives in the city of La Paz’s Alto Taqcagua zone.  Being from a humble family, Franco uses most of his salary to help with household expenses.  He needs the loan to pay for dental care to treat an advanced case of painful tooth decay.  Franco’s dream is to be able to save money to have a business of his own to help his family.  This is the first time he’s been part of KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for dental care.

loans.name: Arroyo Syry Group

texts.es:
El comité Arroyo Syry se encuentra en la ciudad de Paraguarí, este grupo está conformado por 17 mujeres que deciden unirse para formar su grupo y acceder a la ayuda que la Fundación Paraguaya les ofrece; viendo este crédito por algunas como una oportunidad para fortalecer sus actividades y mejorar sus ingresos, y para otras para emprender un nuevo negocio; de manera a mejorar la calidad de vida de los integrantes de sus familias.
Silvina cuenta que su grupo le ha ayudado mucho, y que de a poco está creciendo gracias a todas las capacitaciones y también a los créditos. Ella se dedica a la venta de leche y cuenta que su día de trabajo empieza desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ya que tiene que repartir la leche a sus clientes. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por ser mejor cada día.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche, ya que quiere poder tener un buen stock para poder ofrecer a su clientela. Agradece una vez más por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Arroyo Syry" is located in the city of Paraguarí.  This communal bank is comprised of 17 women who decided to get together and form a group so that they could access the assistance offered by the Fundacion Paraguaya.  They see this loan as an opportunity for some of them to strengthen their businesses and increase their income, and for others as an opportunity to start up a new business.  In this way, the members of this group can improve their family's quality of life.

Silvina says that the group has helped her a lot; her small business is growing thanks to all of the training and loans she has received.  She has a business selling milk, and she says that her day begins in the early hours of the morning, because she has to go out to deliver the milk to her customers.  Silvina is a very hardworking person who strives to improve herself each day.  

Silvina is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of milk, because she wants to have a good inventory to offer to her customers.  She is, once again, grateful for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse est une femme de 29 ans marié père de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 01 et 11, 4 d'entre eux sont scolarisés.Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres secs( coucous maniocs, couscous maïs, farine) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligé de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital.Elle souhaiterai acheter des sacs   de couscous et farine pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thérèse is a 29 year old woman, married and the mother of six children, whose ages vary between one and eleven years - four of them are in school. She is a trader and sells dried foodstuffs retail (couscous, cassava, cornmeal, flour), according to the season. She has been doing this in a local market for ten years. She knows the suppliers well, and also her customers who she has acquired over time due to her experience in this area.
However, she is constantly running out of stock as she is obliged to exhaust her supplies completely in order to be able to buy more, due to her lack of working capital.
She would like to buy sacks of couscous and of flour in order to have a good stock, so she can better meet the constant demand of her customers and avoid being out of stock. She will save her profits, both to grow her business and also to meet her family's expenses.

loans.use: to increase her stock of flour and couscous.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo es casado y vive en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Su hogar es bastante humilde con acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento. 

Rosendo trabaja como transportista durante 10 horas al día (tiene un taxi) siendo él el único sustento que tiene la pareja. Es por eso que necesita un crédito para efectuar el mantenimiento  general de su vehículo ya que viven al día con los ingresos de éste.

El sueño de Rosendo es poder tener un negocio propio donde no tenga que exponerse a trabajar de taxista durante la noche.

Es la primera vez que es parte de kiva
texts.en: Rosendo’s married living in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta zone.  His home is quite humble; it’s faced with bricks and has a cement floor.  Rosendo works providing transportation for 10 hours a day (he has a taxi) and he’s the couple’s only source of support.  This is why he needs a loan to provide general maintenance service to his vehicle because they live day to day thanks to the income it generates.  Rosendo’s dream is to be able to have a business where he doesn't have to be exposed as a taxi driver working at night.  This is the first time he’s part of KIVA.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Seray

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Seray. She is married and has three children ages 10, 8 and 5. She has one additional dependent who lives with her for schooling.  In 2004, Seray established her cosmetics business. She began her business because it enabled her to adequately support her kids. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Seray has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan to buy false hair. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her stock level. In the future, Seray plans to start travelling to Dubai for business, to educate her kids and to own a house. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy false hair

loans.name: Ndèye Anta

texts.fr:
Madame Ndèye Anta est mariée et mère de famille. Elle s’active dans la vente de friperie et a acquis une expérience de 15 ans dans ce domaine. Elle gère une table devant chez elle. Elle vient solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA  pour acheter deux balles de friperies. Elle est une brave femme qui s’occupe des frais de scolarité de sa fille.
Avec le crédit, elle pourra diversifier les produits et  services, épargner un peu d’argent  afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Elle rêve de devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en: Ndèye Anta is married and the mother of a family. Her business is selling secondhand clothing and she has acquired fifteen years experience in this trade. She manages a stall in front of her home. She is requesting a loan of 150,000F CFA in order to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes. She is a decent woman and covers the school fees of her daughter. With this loan, she will be able to diversify her product offering, and save a little money to improve her family's diet. She dreams of becoming a major trader.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of secondhand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Julia Zulema

texts.es: Julia, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre y hermanos en una aldea del municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Hace 6 años ella acondiciono un local pegado a su casa donde ha establecido su propio negocio de venta de comidas como almuerzos, comidas rápidas como baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena con frijoles, queso, huevo y otros), tajadas con carne o pollo frito y refrescos. Trabaja duro desde muy temprano para preparar los alimentos. Para atender a sus clientes recibe ayuda de su madre. Ha decidido obtener un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras para capitalizarse y comprar más insumos necesarios para la elaboración de comidas como almuerzos, baleadas, y otras comidas rápidas. Ella quiere mantener activo su negocio para dar buena atención al cliente e incrementar las ventas y las ganancias. Su sueño es hacer crecer el negocio y con las ganancias tener un bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en: Julia, 32, is single living with her mother and siblings in a village in Esparta municipality, Atlántida.  She set up a space attached to her house six years ago where she runs her food business; she sells breakfasts, fast-food like ‘baleadas’ (flour tortilla filled with beans, cheese, eggs and others) and fried plantain with meat or fried chicken and soft-drinks.  She works hard starting very early preparing the food.  Her mother helps her serve customers.  She’s decided to get an 8,000 Lempira loan to capitalize and buy more necessary ingredients to prepare the meals like breakfasts, baleadas and other fast-food.  She wants to keep the business active to provide good customer service and increase sales and profits.  Her dream is to make the business grow and to use profits to obtain personal and family well-being.

loans.use: to buy food-making ingredients.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Yatta. She is married and has 4 children aged 22, 17, 11, and 5. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her her for schooling.

In 2008, Yatta established her clothing and jewelry business. She began her business just to enable her to take care of her house in the absence of her husband. Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 300,000 Leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Yatta has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy: necklace for 500,000 SLL, shoes for 500,000 SLL and ladies shirts. She hopes that this loan will enable her expand her stock level and hence her income. 

In the future, Yatta plans to own a house, to transform her table into a shop and to educate her children. She is saying thanks to Kiva: she appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia, de 24 años, es una mujer muy jovial, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de conseguir un futuro mejor para su vida y su familia, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre junto a sus 3 hermanos y cada uno de ellos comparte el mismo objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida.
El negocio de Rosalia consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir de todas las marcas, modelos, tamaños y colores. De manera quincenal o mensual se encarga de viajar a la capital de la ciudad para comprar las prendas de vestir al por mayor, luego los pone a la venta entre sus amigos, familiares y otras personas conocidas bajo la modalidad de crédito a plazos. Desde que se inició en éste negocio ha trabajado sola, empezó hace 5 años y ha visto que es una actividad muy rentable porque le genera buenos ingresos que le ayudan a solventar sus gastos personales y los de su familia. Eventualmente vende zapatos o diversos artículos como juguetes y accesorios para niños.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a sus estudios y a realizar algunas labores del hogar cuando sean necesarias, algunas veces a sentido que la dificultad de no saber como realizar sus cobranzas hacía que no cuente con el dinero necesario en el momento preciso para realizar nuevas compras de mercadería, sin embargo poco a poco fue ganándose el respeto y la confianza de sus clientes que no dudan en pagarle en el momento pactado o antes de ello. Deseas más adelante conseguir un local en el que pueda establecer su pequeña tienda de ropas. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, se siente cómoda por pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado (S/ 1500), comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para niños además adquirirá diversos juegotes que tienen gran demanda en la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Roselia, 24, is a very jovial, enterprising woman who very much wants to attain a better future for her life and family.  She’s single and has no children yet; she lives in her mother’s house with her three siblings.  Each of them shares the same objective of improving their quality of life.

Roselia’s business consists in selling clothes of all brands, styles, sizes and colors.  She heads to the capital every two weeks or monthly to buy the clothes at wholesale and then she resells them to her friends, family members and other known people at credit with installment payments.  Since she started the business she’s been working alone; she started five years ago and has seen that it’s very profitable because it generates good income that helps her cover her personal and family expenses.  She also sometimes sells shoes and various other articles like toys and children’s accessories.

What she likes about her activity is that it leaves time for her to dedicate to her studies and to do household chores when necessary.  Sometimes she’s felt that not knowing how to collect her payments due has been a difficulty but she’s gradually been winning over the respect and trust of her customers who now pay her as scheduled and sometimes even ahead of time.  She’d like later on to get a space where she can set up her small clothing store.

This is MFP loan #2 and she’s very happy to know that she has financial support because she’ll feel more secure about being able to advance with her work.  She commits to making her payments punctually and feels comfortable in her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy larger amounts of children’s clothes and will also buy a variety of toys that are in high demand during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, madame Khady loge aux environs du guichet. Elle fait de la vente de poisson frais depuis 10 ans. Elle n’a pas de charges et travaille pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Avec les revenus de son activité, elle a décidé d’acheter un terrain et de le construire petit à petit, ce qui le motive à faire un crédit de 150000F CFA pour démarrer les travaux de construction. Elle a comme ambition de devenir une grande commerçante bien connu et bien appréciée grâce à ses produits.
texts.en: Mrs. Khady, married and the mother of three, lives near the branch office. She has been selling fresh fish for 10 years. She has no dependent children and works in order to improve her family’s life conditions. With the revenues from her business, she has decided to buy a land plot and have construction work carried out little by little, which is what motivated her to do take out a credit of 150,000 West African francs in order to start the construction. Her goal is to be come a well-known vendor  known for the quality of her products.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Don Luis es una persona del páramo ecuatoriano, él se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida, Luis es casado y fruto de ese amor tienen 6, Luis se define como una persona tranquila, alegre trabajador que ama a su familia y quiere darles todo lo que ellos necesiten es por ello que todos los días madruga para trabajar motivado por el amor a su familia.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas de arveja y en plantitas de tomate de árbol, además en la compra de abonos orgánicos para el mantenimiento del suelo y las plantas, la inversión avizora excelentes  los resultados dando mayor producción y calidad en sus productos.

El sueño que Luis  tiene es el comprarse un tractor de cosecha para ser un productor mayorista y distribuir a los mercados de otras provincias del Ecuador. Luis  cree mucho en Dios y sabe que con fe y trabajo el camino al éxito llegara muy pronto.
texts.en:
Luis is a person from the Ecuadorean moorland who has been a farmer all of his life.  Luis is married, and he and his wife have 6 children.  Luis is known to be a tranquil person who is a cheerful worker and loves his family.  He wants to give them everything they need, and for this reason he gets up a dawn every day to work, motivated by his love for his family.

The loan that Luis has requested from Fodemi will be used to purchase pea seeds and tree tomatoes (tamarillos).  In addition, he will buy organic fertilizers to maintain the land and his plants.  He expects excellent results from this investment, including higher yields and better quality crops.

Luis dreams of buying a harvesting tractor, so that he could produce for the wholesale market and distribute his products to markets in other provinces of Ecuador.  Luis has a lot of faith in God, and he knows that faith and hard work will soon put him on a path to success.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds, tamarillo seedlings, and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Dios es Amor está conformado por 9 integrantes, todos mayores de edad, con familia  bajo su responsabilidad. Con 15 bajo su protección, los cuales están estudiando. Estos integrantes de este banco son personas trabajadoras, responsables, se conocen entre sí son de la misma localidad el cual decidieron apoyarse mutuamente para beneficiarse del crédito. La Sra. Bertha es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga del cumplimiento de las cuotas en tiempo y forma ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de champoo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, jabón, huevos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con productos de consumo diario y obtener más clientela. El banco comunal Dios es Amor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
The 'Dios es Amor' (God is Love) community bank has nine members who are all adults with families to care for.  Between them they have 15 dependent children who are all in school.  The members of this group are hard-working, responsible people who know each other because they are all from the same town.  They decided to support each other so that they could benefit from a loan.  

Bertha is the group coordinator and she is in charge of making sure people make their loan repayments on time and in full.  Her business is a grocery store which is located in her home.  There she sells basic household products in small quantities such as coffee sachets, shampoo sachets, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, soap and eggs.  Her aim for this loan is to invest in working capital, stock her business with groceries, and gain more customers.  The 'Dios es Amor' group are grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people living in poor countries like Nicaragua, helping them to create jobs for themselves.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her store with basic groceries such as coffee, shampoo sachets, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, soap and eggs

loans.name: Adilbish

texts.en:
Adilbish is 58 years old and lives with her daughter and son-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her son in law has been working as an excavator operator in private construction business; his earnings vary due to the season. From November to March, he earns 800,000 MNT and in other months he earns 1,000,000 MNT.

Adilbish has retired and receives retirement benefits. As winter comes to Mongolia, people who live in bad quality housing are freezing. Just like these people, she lives in house which has been damaged over the years and needs some serious repair. Due to lack of an insulated garage, the car used in their everyday life is using more fuel and emitting environmentally harmful smoke to the atmosphere.Adilbish is requesting a loan for 5,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials for house improvement and garage building. As a result, the family can live in a warm and comfortable place and most importantly can contribute to the environment by burning less coal thus supporting the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
Vanesa, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia hace 08 años junto a su esposo Henry de 37 años y sus 2 queridos hijos: Rosa de 16 y Jorge de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Vanesa, es una mujer a quien le gusta mucho trabajar y siente gran afición por la venta de abarrotes, este negocio lo ha establecido en la vereda de su casa, ahora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, frijoles, frutas regionales, verduras, plátanos, carnes y otros productos de primera necesidad, adicionalmente a esto vende gaseosas, hielo y helados con los que también genera el dinero necesario para la alimentación y el pago de algunos gastos propios del día, mientras que su esposo aporta el dinero que lo obtiene trabajando como chofer del mototaxi que también ella pudo comprar con algunos ahorros. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que no le demanda mucho esfuerzo y puede mantenerse en reposo, manteniendo controlada su salud ya que hace un tiempo el doctor le recomendó descanso médico, le agrada el ritmo con el que va creciendo su puesto de venta de abarrotes. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner una bodega que le permita mantener su clientela y al mismo tiempo incrementar la cantidad y variedad de los artículos que vende actualmente. Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además se siente muy cómoda trabajando a lado de los integrantes ya que son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 3800), comprará productos de primera necesidad con los que surtirá su puesto de ventas de abarrotes así como también algunas bebidas gaseosas y helados.
texts.en:
Vanesa, 34, is a kind, hardworking woman living in her own house for 8 years with her husband, Henry, 37, and their two beloved children: Rosa, 16, and Jorge, 4, who she wants to provide with a better quality of life.  Vanesa is a woman who loves to work and feels a great affinity for selling groceries.  She set up the business on the sidewalk by her house and she sells groceries, beans, regional fruit, vegetables, bananas, meats and other basic staple items.  In addition, she also sells soft-drinks, ice and frozen treats thus generating income needed for food and for some of her daily expenses.  Her husband contributes by working driving a mototaxi she was able to buy with some savings.

What she likes best about her work is that it’s not too demanding and she can rest thus keeping her health stable because some time ago the doctor recommended that she rest.  She enjoys the rhythm with which her grocery sales are increasing.  In time, she hopes to save up enough money to open a store to retain her customers while at the same time increasing the quantity and variety of items she sells presently.

This is MFP loan #7 and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel more secure about being able to advance with her work.  She commits to make her payments punctually like she did with previous loans she got.  She feels very comfortable working with her fellow communal bank members because they are all very responsible and supportive.  She will use the requested 3,800 soles to buy basic staple items as well as some soft-drinks and frozen treats to stock her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, de 51 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy trabajadora, vive con Jorge de 52 años quien es su conviviente hace 35 años, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales uno es menor de edad y tiene 11 años, está en etapa escolar y depende aún de lo que Zoila y Jorge le ofrecen como padres, ambos comparten sus días y la alegría de educar juntos a sus hijos; vive en su casa propia que consiguió con mucho esfuerzo y toda la familia pone mucho empeño para seguir adelante.  Zoila tiene su negocio de venta de comida y se encarga de la preparación de sabrosos potajes regionales, la clientela es atraída a su puesto de ventas por el inigualable aroma y el agradable sabor casero de sus comidas, vende en la vereda de su casa que está ubicada en un sector muy concurrido por todo tipo de público, aunque solo realiza este trabajo por las noches ha visto que tal actividad le genera buenos ingresos económicos, se inició en este rubro laboral alrededor de 41 años, ya que desde muy niña colaboraba, ayudaba en la cocina y participaba en la preparación de los alimentos al lado de su madre, oficio que también ella realizaba de manera ambulatoria; éste negocio le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijas y pagarles sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea poner un restaurante en su casa, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos de manera diaria y continua buscando consolidar sus ingresos económicos. Zoila disfruta mucho del trabajo que ha venido realizando, mas aún adora ver que sus comensales se van contentos a casa, le agrada conversar con sus clientes mientras disfrutan de sus platillos, algunas veces se le hace muy difícil atender a todas las personas que concurren a su puesto, a pesar de eso no decae en su afán de salir adelante y esta dispuesta a continuar trabajando para lograr su principal anhelo y sabe que poco a poco se llega al éxito siempre y cuando se siga esforzando en lo que hace. Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2500), comprará ingredientes y algunos insumos que necesita para continuar con la preparación de sus platos, así mismo invertirá en materiales de construcción para acondicionar un pequeño local para la atención de sus clientes, por otra lado destinará cierta cantidad en la compra de repuestos de mototaxis.
texts.en:
Zoila, 51, is a kind, cheerful, very hardworking woman living with Jorge, 52, who has been her spouse for 35 years.  They have four children; one of which is still an 11-year-old minor attending school and still dependent on what Zoila and Jorge can offer as parents.  They both share their days and the joy of raising their children together.  She lives in her own house that she acquired after much effort and the entire family puts much effort into continuing to move forward.

Zoila has a business selling food; she prepares delicious regional dishes.  Customers are drawn to her stand by the unique aroma and delicious flavor of her home-cooked meals.  She sells on the sidewalk by her house located in an area with a large number of passersby of all types of people.  Although she only works at night, she’s seen that it generates good income.  She’s been in this line of work for about 41 years because even as a little girl she helped her mother in the kitchen to prepare meals; she was also a street food vendor.  This business has provided her with the necessary money to feed her daughters and pay for their schooling but she feels that her expenses will rise later on and she will need money.  This is why she wants to open a restaurant at home so she can sell her delicious dishes more comfortably every day; she continues to seek a way to consolidate her income.

Zoila enjoys her work very much, more so now when she sees that her diners leave her house happy.  She enjoys chatting with her customer while they enjoy their meals.  Sometimes it’s very difficult for her to take care of everyone who comes by her stand but despite this she does not falter in her drive to get ahead and is willing to continue working to reach her main wish.  She knows that success is reached little by little as long as one continues striving toward it.

This is MFP loan #7 and she’s grateful for the opportunity and the trust placed in her by granting this loan.  She commits to make her payments punctually and she enjoys being part of the communal bank she belongs to because she notes that the members are all responsible, supportive people.

She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy ingredients and some supplies she needs to continue preparing her dishes and will also invest in building materials to set up a small space to tend to her customers.  On the other hand, she will also set aside a certain amount to buy mototaxi spare parts.

loans.use: to buy food-preparation ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old, married and has two children.  He is a van driver.  In addition, he does dairy farming.  He has been in business for three years. 

He also assists his wife who is a tea farmer.  He is very hardworking and thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learned how to manage his business. 
Someday, he wishes to increase his herd of cattle and also buy more vans.  He requires a loan of 74,013.75 KES  to buy a cow, cow feed and a wheel barrow.

loans.use: to buy a cow, cow feed and  wheel barrow.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 37 years old, married, and has seven children who attend school.  She lives in Montserrado County, which is noted as the most commercial city in Liberia. For the past eight years, she has been involved in the sales of bananas, oranges, and pineapples. She started this business with a small amount of money from her aunt and she learned this ways of selling from her mother. 

Victoria is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more bananas, Oranges, and pineapples. What she likes about her business is that it helps her take care of children and makes her feel proud of sending her children to school. Her future plan is to educate her children.  Her challenge is the transportation cost to get her supply.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, Oranges, and pineapples.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Elisabeth to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator to keep drinks. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Elisabeth independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es:
El señor Atilio es Mecánico, tiene un Taller de Motos, hace trabajo de mantenimiento y otros, trabaja de lunes a sábados cuenta con dos personal quienes lo ayudan.
Atilio gracias a este trabajo ayuda a sus padres, con quienes vive, es una persona muy trabajadora y que quiere salir adelante. Comenta que al principio fue difícil empezar su negocio, pero que después se fue haciendo conocido y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo  para compra de repuestos para motos, los cuales usara para su taller. Agradece nuevamente a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad de crecimiento, y promete cumplir siempre.
texts.en: Atilio is a mechanic; he has a motorcycle repair shop.  He does maintenance work and others.  He works Monday through Saturday and has a staff of two helpers.  Thanks to this work, Atilio is able to help his parents who he lives with.  He’s a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead.  He comments that it was difficult at the beginning to start his business but he gradually became known and to date he has a very good clientele.  He’s asking for the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to use in his shop.  He once again thanks the Fundación and KIVA for this growth opportunity and promises to always pay.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
This is Merlyn, 32, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Dennis and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. She works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.

Merlyn oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories, and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Merlyn dreams that her children will finish their studies and hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Mara Cecilia

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Mara compró materias primas para ofrecer en su restaurante diversas y deliciosas comidas que vendió muy pronto.su negocio experimentó crecimiento y tiene mas ingresos por las ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo creidkiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e implementos para cocinar nuevos platos de comida, en la temporada que se acerca en la cual debe desplegar una oferta de acuerdo con las festividades navideñas y de fin de año. Ella está muy agradecida con los finaciadores de Kiva y dice "Gracias por el apoyo brindado"
texts.en: Mara used her previous Kiva loan to buy raw materials to offer diverse, delicious dishes in her restaurant; she sold out quickly and the business grew.  Now, her income is higher thanks to the sales.  She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy raw materials and kitchen utensils to cook new dishes because she must be ready with dishes proper for the upcoming Christmas and New Year’s season.  She’s very grateful to Kiva lenders and says: “Thanks for the support provided.”

loans.use: to buy ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
This is Myra, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a driver. She is also a mother to her children. With her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Myra maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Because the dealer’s prices are lower than those listed in the catalogue, the dealer is able to make a profit on the items. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Myra dreams to expand her business and hopes that her family will have good health. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 5 años de edad en la ciudad de Cartagena,  donde se dedica a la venta de prendas de plata y también vende dulces entre sus principales clientes,  que son sus vecinos y referidos por estos,  en otros sectores de la ciudad, a quienes les vende a crédito y de contado, diariamente trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su idea de negocio nació,  porque fue empleada de un almacén de joyas y aprendió a conocer la calidad de estas, especialmente las producidas en plata, y  tiempo después se independizó e inició la venta de cadenas, aretes, pulsos y pulseras. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen prendas de plata que distribuirá entre sus clientes, quienes desde ya,  han hecho sus pedidos para lucirlos en navidad y año nuevo. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y tener su propia casa, porque su mayor desafío,  es brindar a su hijo las mejores condiciones de bienestar, para que tengan un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Ángela lives with her spouse and 5-year-old son in the city of Cartagena where she works selling silver jewelry and also candy to her main customers who are her neighbors and people from other parts of the city referred to her by them.  She sells on credit and for cash working every day from 8am until 6pm.  

Her business idea arose because she was jewelry store employee and learned how to recognize quality jewelry, especially items make of silver and sometime later she became independent and started selling chains, earrings and bracelets.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a larger amount of silver jewelry items to sell among her customers who have already placed orders for items to sport at Christmas and New Year’s.  Her goal is to make the business grow and to own a house because her greatest challenge is to provide the best well-being conditions for her son to have a successful future.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of silver jewelry items.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Angel es un afortunado Sr. de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Santaní, tiene su negocio en su casa el cual es una despensa, y aparte de eso distribuye productos extras por la zona y alrededores. Él es muy emprendedor, comento que le gusta mucho ayudarles a las personas más necesitadas.
Comenta que se dedica a esto hace más 5 años y que ya tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy bien surtido su negocio y todo a muy buen precio y calidad. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y solicita este crédito para la compra de bebidas y demás insumos para su despensa, ya que en estas fiestas es cuando más ventas tiene y quiere poder surtirse.
Su objetivo es agrandar su local y tener un camión para la distribución de sus productos.
texts.en:
Angel is 33 years old and is a lucky man. He lives in the city of Santaní. He has a grocery business in his home, and also distributes extra products to the surrounding area. He is very entrepreneurial, and commented that he enjoys helping the needy.

He says he has been dedicated to this for more than 5 years and already has a good clientele since he is always well-stocked and has very good prices and quality. He is grateful for the opportunity that he received by requesting this loan for the purchase of drinks and other supplies for sale. Since it is the holiday season, there are more sales and he wants be stocked.

His goal is to enlarge his premises and to have a truck for the distribution of his products.

loans.use: to buy drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a businessman who runs mobile phone money transfer business.  He has been running this business for two years and has employed one person. He also does farming and runs a barber shop.  With help from Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and become more financially stable.  He has also been able to build his own house.

Joseph has requested a loan of 84,442 KES to add float (money) to his mobile business transaction business.

loans.use: to add float (money) to his mobile business transaction business

loans.name: Dièyi

texts.fr: La dame Diéyi fait parti des anciennes clientes du guichet. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans en vendant des légumes, du poisson et divers autres produits alimentaires. Elle vient solliciter pour la 4ème fois un crédit afin d’acheter des légumes et du poisson. Compte  tenu de la faiblesse des revenus de son mari, elle lui est d’un grand appui en participant activement à la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Madame Diéyi désire devenir une grande commerçante dans l’avenir avec l’appui d’une institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en: Madame Diéyi is an old customer of the branch. She has been selling vegetables, fish, and miscellaneous products for over 15 years. She is seeking a loan for the fourth time in order to buy vegetables and fish. Due to her husband’s dwindling income, she is under a lot of pressure to actively participate in her household’s daily expenses. Madame Diéyi would like to become a big seller in the future with help from a financial institution like IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fish to sell

loans.name: Maredel

texts.en:
Maredel is a 35-year-old married woman with three young children (one girl and two boys) from Sikatuna, Bohol. She has been operating a sari sari store (variety store) for a year. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a LGU or Local Government Unit driver for the Mayor in their town.
 
Maredel is requesting a loan to buy soap, sugar, oil, soy sauce, and other items to sell in her store. Through this loan, she will be able to buy such items to attract nearby customers. And through that, she will earn more income. In the future, Maredel hopes to expand her business and to gain more profit.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, oil, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Halimatou

texts.fr: Halimatou est  une jeune femme de 28 ans célibataire sans enfant. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 2 ans déjà, elle fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Halimatou is a young, single 28-year-old woman with no children. After her training, she opened a small sewing shop which has been operating for 2 years. She also does embroidery, but she doesn’t have all the material she needs to keep up with her orders and be able to satisfy her clientele in time. This is why she is seeking a loan to buy fabric and small sewing supplies (pins, needles, lining, thread,…) which will prevent her from needing to go to the market all the time and instead be able to sew and sell to her customers. The profits that come from this loan will allow her not only to buy her little sewing supplies to grow her business, but also to satisfy some of her needs as well as those of her small family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and small sewing supplies

loans.name: Bibiane Myriam

texts.fr: Bibiane est  une jeune femme de 38 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 2 ans déjà, elle fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Bibiane is a young, married 38-year-old woman with four children. After her training, she opened a small sewing shop which has been operating for 2 years. She also does embroidery, but she doesn’t have all the material she needs to keep up with her orders and be able to satisfy her clientele in time. This is why she is seeking a loan to buy fabric and small sewing supplies (pins, needles, lining, thread,…) which will prevent her from needing to go to the market all the time and instead be able to sew and sell to her customers. The profits that come from this loan will allow her not only to buy her little sewing supplies to grow her business, but also to satisfy some of her needs as well as those of her small family.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Rojas families each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and provide for their families better security conditions

loans.name: Juan's Group

texts.en: Juan, Catalino and Alejandra live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 2 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where this picture was taken). Very few of the households in this region have energy access and they rely on ocote wood to light their households. Ocote sends out a lot of smoke and gives out very little light. This does not allow the family of Juan (he has three children) to have an adequate environment for any activities in their household. Ocote is also a health, security and environmental hazard. Juan works in the field, mainly with corn and consumes more than 8 pieces of ocote each week for lighting, his community and other households get these by cutting down trees in nearby forests. This mean of lighting is not only hazardous for Juan and his family, it is also dangerous because their households can burn down and it is also beginning to affect the environment due to the high deforestation that this activity is provoking in the surrounding areas. Deforestation also causes population and their homes to be more exposed to natural disasters. Cerro Niño is a community located in hill slopes so without trees, landslides are more common. This is something that happened during Hurricane Carlota for example. People are left with out communication for weeks when this happens. He is very excited on acquiring a solar home system to light up and to charge his cellphone for emergencies.

loans.use: Juan, Catalino and Alejandra to stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting and allows each of them to buy a reliable solar home system for quality lighting and cell-phone charging.

location.town: Cerro Niño, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Jenaro, Felícita and Donaldo to each purchase a solar system for their homes and carpentry shops to stop relying on candles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Gilberto, Alfonso and Santiago each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Nicolas and Marciano each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access.

loans.name: Rodolfo's Group

texts.en: Rodolfo and Felix live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In El Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which they mention can last up to 8 days whenever it rains due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value through savings on their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes. Both Rodolfo and Felix have made a great effort to support their children continuing school; Rodolfo has two kids, one in preschool and one in elementary school, and Felix has four: two in elementary, one in a remote secondary school and one studying a technical career in a town nearby, but still living with his parents. When there is a several days blackout, all of Rodolfo´s and Felix children have to study in their homes by the lights of candles. A loan for a solar home system will not only provide better studying conditions for his children, it will allow both families to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work to continue supporting their children so they don't have to leave school to support family income.

loans.use: Rodolfo and Felix each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and support their children education

loans.name: Buenaventura's Group

texts.en: Buenaventura, his cousin Cirilo and Marcelo live in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec, Oaxaca. They each provide for a family of six and work in the field cultivating corn. Everyday they must travel to their workplace, more than an hour away walking distance, where they have a small field house where they take care of their crops. Buenaventura and his eldest son stay over to sleep at this house in the field, where they have no electricity supply. They rely on candles and have no place to charge their cell-phone, their only means of communication for emergencies and to stay in touch with their families during that days they are working. With your loan they will be able to have reliable LED lighting through a solar home system and charge their cell-phones to be able to communicate with their families.

loans.use: Buenaventura and his group buy a solar home system to have reliable light.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Demetrio and his two neighbors each purchase a solar system to have reliable energy access for their workplace.

loans.name: Otilio's Group

texts.en: Otilio, Antonio and Gregorio live in El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. Their main occupation is in the field where they cultivate corn and beans. Gregorio is 62 years old and provides for a family of 7. In El Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid in early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which according to Otilio is an average of 3 days per month and 8 days in the rainy season, and in order for his family to work and study, they spend around 10 Mexican Pesos (0.8 USD) on candles every day. During this time, they run out of energy on their cell-phones and have no way of communicating with the nearby centers. With your loan they will have the security of having everyday lighting and energy for their mobile phones, ensuring an adequate place to work, study and spend quality time with their family.

loans.use: Gregorio and his two neighbors each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access for lighting and communication in their homes.

loans.name: Segundo Roberto

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero y terminó estudios de la secundaria en Alausí en donde reside actualmente y además está estudiando para aprender sobre computación y otras ramas que le pueden ayudar a crecer en su negocio. Alausí es un cantón de la Provincia de Chimborazo en Ecuador la cual se caracteriza por su estructura arquitectónica en piedra y flores que la convirtieron en un atractivo turístico muy visitado y que además le dieron el título de Patrimonio Nacional. A lo largo de la ciudad se encuentran varios sitios naturales que valen la pena ser visitados por el paisaje tan esplendoroso que ofrecen. La actividad turística, la agricultura, el comercio se fortalecen cada día para que la ciudad tenga un desarrollo sostenido y que sus habitantes tengan una mejor calidad de vida ya que no todas las viviendas cuentan con todos los servicios básicos.
Segundo nació en el campo y creció aprendiendo la labor de la agricultura. Actualmente se dedica a la producción y posterior comercialización de granos. Invierte 8 horas al día en este negocio. El piensa que en todo negocio es importante ofrecer variedad de productos para poder crecer, por lo tanto por su experiencia adquirida en la rama de la agricultura, piensa que hay productos que también son demandados por los clientes como papas, zanahoria y otros vegetales, los cuales desea empezar a sembrar para lo cual requiere un crédito que le permita comprar las semillas y los insumos necesarios para la siembra de los mismos. Además desea comprar ganado vacuno para criarlo y luego venderlo. Todo esto le ayudará a aportar en su casa con el sustento diario y además a seguir preparándose académicamente para obtener la preparación que un microempresario requiere.
texts.en:
Segundo is 21 years old and is single. He finished his secondary studies in Alausí where he currently lives. He is also studying to learn about computers and other things that can help him grow his business.

Alausí is a canton of the province of Chimborazo in Ecuador. It is know for its stone architectural structures and flowers which turned it into a highly visited tourist attraction. It also has the title of Patrimonio Nacional (National Heritage). There are several natural sites throughout the city that are worth visiting because of the magnificent landscape. With the tourism and agriculture, commerce becomes stronger each day allowing the city to have a sustained development and its inhabitants to have a better quality of life, since not all homes have basic services.

Segundo was born in the country and raised learning about agriculture. He is currently dedicated to the production and commercialization of grains. He spends 8 hours a days working. He thinks it is important to offer a variety of products in order to grow a business. Therefore, with his experience in agriculture, he thinks that there are products in high demand by customers such as potatoes, carrots and other vegetables. This is what he wants to start planting. For this he requires a loan that will allow him to buy seeds and supplies for planting them. He also wants to buy cattle to raise, then sell.

All of this will help him to contribute to the livelihood of his home and also to continue preparing academically to become a micro-businessman.

loans.use: to buy cattle and vegetable seeds to diversify his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Ignacio, Justino ana Valentin to buy a reliable solar home system and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

loans.name: Abi Noemi's Group

texts.en: Abi and Gerenia and their families live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In el Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which they mention can last up to 8 days during whenever it rains due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value through saving on their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes when there are blackouts. Both women contribute to their families income by producing clay products that they sell in nearby tourist spots and in nearby commerce centers. They belong to a cooperative of women that is called “Mujeres Trabajadoras de Tiltepec” (Working Woman from Tiltepec) and they participate in different exhibitions and are starting to sell their products to different foundations and bigger crafts shops. A loan for a solar home system will allow this working women to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work and generate higher incomes for their families.

loans.use: Abi and Gerenia each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and gain 4 hours more to produce clay products

loans.name: Karellis

texts.es: Karellis de 30 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 10 años en el municipio de Sabanagrande,  a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Antes de tener su negocio,  la  fuente  de ingreso de su hogar, la suministraba su esposo; hoy vendiendo mercancía variada ha logrado apoyar el bienestar de su hogar y ha logrado una mayor autonomía para si misma. Los principales productos que vende a crédito y de contado, son los utensilios de cocina y ropa entre vecinos y referidos,  por estos que viven en lugares distintos de la población. Su meta es aumentar sus ventas, pero su principal desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo, para lograr satisfacer la demanda de su clientela,  especialmente en la época de navidades   y año nuevo,  en la que sus clientes tienen recursos para comprar y hacen muchos pedidos para lucir elegantes, esperando la celebración de sus fiestas en familia. Esta es la razón por la cual acude  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil, y electrodomésticos menores. Como sus compras las hace sobre los pedidos  sus clientes fieles, que pagan oportunamente, el éxito de su credikiva resulta ser muy real.
texts.en: Karellis, 30, lives with her spouse and two children who are 7 and 10 years of age in the municipality of Sabanagrande, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  Before having her business her family’s sole source of income was her husband.  Today, selling varied merchandise has contributed to her family’s well-being and she’s attained more personal autonomy herself.  The main products she sells both for cash and on credit are kitchen utensils and clothes.  She sells to neighbors and to people from other parts of the city that are referred to her by them.  Her goal is to increase sales but her main challenge is the lack of sufficient working capital to meet customer demand especially during the Christmas and New Year’s season which is when her customers have the resources to buy and they place many orders to look elegant during the family celebrations.  This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy clothes for women, men and children and to buy small home appliances.  Because she makes her purchases based on prior orders from her loyal customers who pay on time, her Kiva loan’s success bodes real.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women, men and children and to buy small appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Benito, Dagoberto and Policarpio acquire a solar home system to increase their working hours and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Ramiro, Valentín and Justina to buy a reliable solar home system and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Guadalupe, Pablo and Felix purchase a solar home system to increase their working conditions when processing sugar cane and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

loans.name: Macario's Group

texts.en: Macario his wife Catalina and his daughter in law Lidia live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In el Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out. They mention blackouts can last up to 8 days during the rainy season due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value, providing savings in their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes when there are blackouts. Both women contribute to their families income and belong to a cooperative of women that is called “Mujeres Trabajadoras de Tiltepec” (Working Woman from Tiltepec). This cooperative participates in different exhibitions and is helping women to sell their products to different foundations and bigger crafts shops. Catalina is teaching her daughter-in-law Lidia to work with clay, and Macario is in charge of selling the products because Catalina only speaks Chatino and can't communicate with clients in Spanish. A loan for a solar home system will allow these working women to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work and generate higher incomes for their families.

loans.use: Macario, Catalina and Lidia each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and gain 4 hours more to produce clay products

loans.name: Casimir

texts.fr: casimir est un homme de 44 ans marié père d'un enfant de 12 ans. Il est commerçant et a ouvert un comptoir dans un marché de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son acceuiel chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Il sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock d'huile de palme parce que c'est un produit très consommé par son entourage et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Casimir is a 44-year-old married father of a 12-year-old child. He is a shopkeeper and opened a counter in a market in the capital that he’s been running for 2 years. His small business works due to his warm welcome, his experience in this area, and the clientele he has acquired over time. The latter has become sizeable, so much so that he can no longer satisfy them because of the small size of his capital which forces him to buy at retail. He is seeking this loan to augment his stock of palm oil because it’s a heavily consumed product by those around him and to be able to increase his profit margin. He will reinvest a portion of his profits back into this business to cover the needs of his business and another portion will allow him to meet his daily needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to augment the stock of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a home water purification and drainage system.

loans.name: Jeanne Marie Francine

texts.fr: Jeanne est une femme de 34 ans, célibataire et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est commerçante et fait dans la vente des mèches et produits de beautédans un coin de la place depuis 1 ans. Elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligé de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter des greffes et mèches (150 pièces) pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Jeanne is a 34-year-old single mother of three.  She is a merchant, selling hair extensions and beauty products in a corner of the town square for a year. She constantly finds herself out of stock, because she needs to get rid of all the stock to be able to get more because of the small size of her capital. She would like to buy weaves and extensions (150 pieces) to have a good stock which will allow her to better satisfy the constant demand of her clientele and to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits not only to grow her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica, una mujer que vive en la cuidad de Ibarra tiene tres hijos Angélica se define como una mujer honesta, honrada muy trabajadora, siendo un ejemplo siendo un ejemplo para sus hijos, Angélica busca siempre la manera de salir adelante para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi es para la compra de mercadería como sabanas, cobijas y en la compra de ropa deportiva para la venta en su local comercial y cuando sale a vender en las afueras de la ciudad. Siendo este un trabajo cansado pero que lo hace con mucho amor para brindar a sus hijas todo lo que necesiten.

El sueño que Doña Angélica tiene es comprarse un local en el centro de compras de la ciudad de Ibarra  donde pueda vender sus productos, ella está segura que con trabajo lo va a lograr, y con estos ingresos darles la educación universitaria a su hijas que todavía viven y dependen de su madre.
texts.en:
Angélica’s a woman living in the city of Ibarra; she has three children.  Angélica defines herself as an honest, honorable, very hardworking woman who sets  an example for her children to follow.  Angélica is always seeking a way to get ahead and meet her family’s needs.

The loan she’s asking Fodemi for is to buy merchandise like sheets and blankets and to buy sportswear to sell in her commercial site and to sell when she goes into the city’s outskirts.  This is demanding work but she does it with much love to provide her children with everything they need.

Angélica’s dream is to buy a locale in the city of Ibarra’s shopping center where she can sell her goods.  She’s sure that with work she’ll accomplish this and with income earned will be able to provide university educations for her daughters who still live with and depend on their mother.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets and sportswear to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, who previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Lolita is requesting another 13,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita hopes for a good life and business growth. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Barama

texts.fr: Barama est une jeune femme de 45 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants, tous sont scolarisés. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 10 ans déjà, elle n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter 2 machines d'occasion et des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Barama is a young, 45-year-old married mother of six, all of whom attend school. After her training, she opened a small sewing shop which has been operating for 10 years. She doesn’t have all the material she needs to keep up with her orders and be able to satisfy her clientele in time. This is why she is seeking a loan to buy two secondhand sewing machines, fabric, and small sewing supplies (pins, needles, lining, thread,…) which will prevent her from needing to go to the market all the time and instead be able to sew and sell to her customers. The profits that come from this loan will allow her not only to buy her little sewing supplies to grow her business, but also to satisfy some of her needs as well as those of her small family.

loans.use: to buy two secondhand sewing machines, fabric, and small sewing supplies

loans.name: Alma Marina

texts.es: La señora Alma, es madre soltera por viudez, tiene 41 años, tiene dos hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro sula junto a uno de sus hijos. Ella lleva varios  años ganándose la vida vendiendo mercadería en general como ropa usada, para damas, caballeros y niños (blusas, camisas, jeans, camisetas y otros) y zapatos. Hace tres años diversifico su negocio y ahora vende también comida para el desayuno y frutas como naranjas, manzanas, uvas, bananos y fruta de temporada. Esta solicitando el segundo préstamo a ODEF, este es a corto plazo y es por 5,000 Lempiras, el cual lo va invertir en compra de uvas, manzanas y peras para vender en la temporada de navidad. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Tiene como meta trabajar mucho para que su hijo termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alma is a widow and a single mother.  She is 41 years old, and has 2 children.  She lives with one of her children in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula. 

She has been earning a living for a number of years by selling general merchandise, such as used clothing for men, women and children (blouses, shirts, jeans, T-shirts, and other items) and shoes.  Three years ago she diversified her business, and she now also sells breakfast food and fruits, including oranges, apples, grapes, bananas and other seasonal fruit.  

Alma is requesting her second loan with ODEF.  This is a short term loan for 5,000 Honduran lempiras, which she will use to invest in the purchase of grapes, apples, and pears to sell during the Christmas season.  This investment will help her to increase her sales and income.  

Alma's goal is to work hard so that her son can finish his education.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit, apples, and grapes to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
This is Teresa, 47, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Isidro, a driver and a father to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, Teresa is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Teresa oversees and owns operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits to her a boundary (daily quota) each day. In her business, the regular customers are members of the local community. Teresa earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Teresa is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Teresa dreams to give her children a good and quality education. Each week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle transportation business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy buena, amable y trabajadora, esta separada de quien fue su conviviente por muchos años, en la actualidad vive en su casa propia que construyó al lado de su ex pareja, lo habita junto a 3 de sus 4 hijos y comparte junto a ellos su día a día y su lucha por mejorar juntos su nivel de vida. Rocío es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, se dedica a varias actividades que le genera ingresos económicos tales como: lavar ropa ajena, vende ropas usadas, vende refrescos los fines de semana, pero su actividad más importante se centra en la venta de comida, trabaja en un establecimiento que alquila dentro de una sede estatal y ahí ofrece diversos platillos que son del agrado de todos sus clientes. Prepara los mas deliciosos platillos peruanos como “arroz con pollo”, “papa a la huancaína”, “ají de gallina” “lomo saltado” y otros, cada potaje lo acompaña con deliciosos refrescos como “chicha morada” o “aguajina”. Cumple esta función desde hace 5 años y trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite decidir su horario de trabajo, puede manejar su tiempo y dedicarlo a diferentes actividades, sigue adelante en su trabajo porque le gusta lo que hace y espera con el paso del tiempo poder tener un restaurante modesto en donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad. Este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. El monto solicitado (S/. 1800), lo invertirá en la compra de algunos ingredientes que necesita para preparar la comida que pone a la venta como arroz, papa, carnes, condimentos, aceite y otros.
texts.en: Rocío is a friendly and hardworking 51-year-old woman. She is separated from her common-law husband of many years. Currently she lives in her own house that she built next to her ex-partner. Three of their four children live with her, and day after day they fight together to create a better life for themselves. She is a woman who has always worked to get ahead. She is involved in various activities to generate income, such as washing clothes, selling used clothes and selling soft drinks on the weekends. However, her most important activity is focused on food sales. She rents a space within a government building and offers various dishes that are well-received by her customers. She makes the most delicious Peruvian dishes, such as “arroz con pollo” (chicken with rice), “papa a la huancaína" (potatoes with a special sauce) “lomo saltado” (salted beef loin), “ají de gallina” (hen with chili peppers) and others. These are always served with delicious drinks such as “chicha morada” (a rice and fruit-based drink) or “aguajina”, which is made from palm tree fruit. She has been doing this work for five years and has help from her children. What Rocío likes most about her work is that she is able to set her own schedule so that she can manage her time and dedicate it to various activities. Her business is progressing because she likes what she does, and she hopes that in time she will be able to have a modest restaurant in which she can provide greater comfort to her customers. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the opportunity and faith that the institution has put in her. She promises to comply with her loan repayment schedule. She is also glad to be part of her communal bank, since the members are responsible and supportive. The funds she is seeking (1800 nuevos soles) will be invested in various ingredients that she needs in order to make the food that she sells. This will include rice, potatoes, meats, condiments, oil and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, meat, condiments, oil and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal las palomas, está conformado por 10 integrantes hombre y mujeres los cuales son padres de familias con responsabilidad de la crianza de sus hijos.
