Estos integrantes  son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona  norte del país. Estas personas de caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, buenas paga  ya que lo han demostrado en los créditos anteriores. Juana María es la coordinadora del banco comunal Las  Palomas ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación , una pulpería es un pequeña tienda que vende productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como sobres de café, sobres de shapoo, cigarros por unidad, tiste, cuajada, queso, huevo , caja de fosforo, arroz, frijoles. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes. El banco comunal las Palomas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es  Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Las Palomas" communal bank is made up of ten male and female members who are parents responsible for raising their children. These members are natives of Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country. These people are known for being hardworking, responsible, driven to better themselves, and financially dependable, as they have demonstrated with their previous loans.

Juana María is the coordinator of the "Las Palomas" communal bank. Her source of income is a small "pulpería" located in her house. A "pulpería" is a small store that sells everyday household products in small quantities, like packets of coffee, packets of shampoo, individual cigarettes, tiste [a traditional Nicaraguan drink made from corn and cacao], cuajada [a traditional cheese curd], cheese, eggs, boxes of matches, rice, and beans. 

Juana María's objective for this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her store to provide better service to her customers. The "Las Palomas" communal bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to have working capital and to stock her grocery store with packets of coffee, packets of shampoo, cigarettes for individual sale, tiste [a traditional Nicaraguan drink], cuajada [a traditional cheese curd], cheese, eggs, matches, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Lindas flores naturales, fue lo que Juan compró con su credikiva, por eso vendió mucho mas y tambien compró floreros en mayor cantidad de lo usual con los que hizo hermosos arreglos florales. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará flores como las rosas, claveles, pompones, margaritas, follajes, oasis y tambien ampliará el surtido de flores artificales, pues ellas tienen una buena demanda en la temporda de fin de año, porque los arreglos navideños, forman parte de los regalos que se hacen las familias entre si, para mostrar su cariño y celebrar la unidad del hogar de Dios. Su mensaje a los financiadors de Kiva es el siguiente: "Es importante para nosotros contar con entidades como las que apoyan al pequeño empresario. Agradezco esa nueva oportunidad que me dan para fortalecer mi negocio."
texts.en:
Juan bought beautiful natural flowers with his last Kiva loan.  As a result he increased his sales a lot, and also bought vases in a larger quantity than usual with which he made beautiful flower arrangements.  Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan that he will use to buy flowers such as: roses, carnations, pom poms, daisies, greenery and flower foam.  He will also increase his inventory of artificial flowers, because there is a strong seasonal demand for these toward the end of the year, as Christmas flower arrangements are gifts that many families give each other to show their affection and celebrate the unity of the house of God.  

His message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "It is important for us to be able to rely on the institutions that support small businesses.  Thank you for the new opportunity that you are giving me to strengthen my business."

loans.use: to buy flowers such as roses, carnations, pom poms, daisies, greenery, floral foam, and artificial flowers

loans.name: Floripe

texts.en:
This is Floripe. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household, and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Floripe dreams of expanding her business and helping her children finish their studies through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 26-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines and is the mother of two young children.  She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than five years now.

Gina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, buckets, hooks, and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Gina hopes to make her business a success in the future. Also, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, buckets, hooks, and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy, de 25 años, es una mujer muy valiente y luchadora, es soltera y sin hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus dos hermanos compartiendo el día a día buscando el progreso familiar. La actividad que desarrolla Cindy consiste principalmente en brindar servicio de atención a pacientes con alguna dolencia o que requieren de atención médica inmediata o rutinaria. Recientemente ha iniciado esta nueva faceta para desarrollar su profesión de enfermera ya que considera que la vida y la salud de las personas es lo primordial para seguir adelante. Atiende a cualquier persona que necesite ayuda brindándole la orientación necesaria hasta que logren ser atendidos por un médico especialista. Realiza todo tipo de análisis o exámenes médicos siempre con mucha responsabilidad, respeto y confidencialidad hacia el paciente. Lleva en esta labor recién 1 año y hasta momento le va muy bien. En sus ratos libre se dedica a la venta de ropas a crédito por pedidos específicos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su familia en el momento que sea necesario. Espera seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora y poco a poco implementar su local de atención con la adquisición de nuevos implementos de laboratorio para empezar a realizar análisis diversos. Este es el crédito grupal número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo la socia puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas como lo hizo en los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer a su grupo de trabajo ya que todos sus miembros son responsables y muy solidarios entre si.
Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles, comprará artículos de asepsia como guantes quirúrgicos, alcohol, algodón, jeringas, y algunas pastillas para malestares leves. Además adquirirá un lote de prendas de vestir para venderlos en temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Cindy, 25, is a courageous and tenacious woman.  She is single and has no children.  She lives in her parent's house along with her 2 siblings, sharing the daily struggle for family progress.  Cindy has a business where she provides services to patients who have a medical condition, or who need urgent or routine medical care.  She started this new phase in developing her profession as a nurse, because she considers that the life and health of people is foremost in enabling people to move ahead.

Cindy cares for anyone who needs her help, providing them with the necessary guidance until they can be seen by a specialist.  She does all types of medical exams and tests, always with a lot of responsibility, respect, and confidentiality toward the patient.  She has been doing this work for a year, and up until now it's been going very well.  In her spare time, Cindy sells clothing on credit, based on specific orders.  What she enjoys about her work is that it allows her to have time to devote to her family when she needs it.

Cindy hopes to continue to work as she has done until now, and gradually set up her own medical clinic, acquiring new laboratory equipment  so that she could start to do a variety of types of tests.  This is her 5th loan with MFP, and she is very content to know that she has financial support to continue increasing her working capital.  Also, she is certain that she will continue to be a member who is punctual and responsible with her payments, as she was with her previous loans.  Cindy enjoys belonging to her communal bank, because all of the members are responsible and very supportive of one another.  

With the sum of 3,500 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy sterile medical products such as surgical gloves, alcohol, cotton, syringes, and pills for minor discomfort.  She will also purchase an assortment of clothing to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy sterile medical products such as surgical gloves, alcohol, cotton, syringes, and pills for minor discomfort.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a 63-year-old married woman from Loboc, Bohol. She has two grown children, ages 36 and 32, both males. She has been engaged in a hog-raising or piggery business for three years now. This is the source of her income. Her monthly income is 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Her husband is a Barangay Kagawad (village councilor) in their town.

Aurelia is requesting a loan to buy piglets to be raised in her home. By the use of this loan, she can earn more income when she sells them if there is a buyer.

Aurelia dreams to expand her business in the future and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Getulio

texts.es:
Getulio, de 47 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, alegre con ganas de superación. Es soltero, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 20 y 19 años de edad además de su madre, quiere mucho a cada uno de los miembros de su familia y por ellos se esfuerza día a día para mejorar su calidad de vida. La actividad que realiza Getulio es la venta ambulatoria de golosinas y plátanos fritos conocidos como chifles, también se dedica al alquiler de su mototaxi para generarse un ingreso adicional. Principalmente, las golosinas y los plátanos fritos lo elabora en su domicilio con la ayuda de sus hijos, para ello se abastece con la materia prima que son racimos de plátanos “bellacos” o verdes, corta uno por uno y luego los fríe, finalmente lo embolsa y se dirige a las calles de las ciudad para vender cada bolsa acompañándolo con salsa de cebolla. Decidió iniciarse en éste negocio hace más de 2 años, tiempo que le valió para lograr crecer y hacerse conocido por la calidad el delicioso sabor de sus productos. Considera rentable a ésta actividad por que es fácil de realizar y por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Además le agrada relacionarse con las demás personas y entablar amistad con sus clientes habituales. Viendo sus ganancias a diario va  invirtiendo nuevamente para así poder tener más efectivo, deseando crecer y producir en mayor volumen para vender al por mayor en las bodegas de los asentamientos humanos. Este es el crédito individual numero 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado, además esta muy decidido a cumplir una vez más con sus pagos de manera puntual como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores, le agrada mucho ser cliente de la institución ya que le brindan todo el apoyo necesario para seguir adelante. 
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de insumos como racimos de plátano, aceite, bolsas, cebolla, limones y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los "chifles", también comprará una carga de leña que usa para el fogón donde fríe los plátanos.
texts.en:
Getulio, who is 47 years old, is a happy and hard-working man who has a desire for self-improvement.  He is single and lives in his own home with his two children, who are 20 and 19 years old.  His mother also lives with them.  Getulio loves each member of his family very much and he works hard everyday to improve their quality of life.  Getulio's business is street sales of sweets and fried bananas, known as "chifles."  He also rents his "mototaxi" (a motor bike taxi used for transportation services), which generates some additional income.  He principally makes the sweets and fried bananas in his house, with the help of his children.  To make them, he stocks up on raw materials, such as "bellaco," or green, bananas.  He cuts them up one at a time and then fries them.  Finally, he bags them up and heads out the to city streets to sell them.  Each bag of "chilfes" is sold with onion sauce.  Getulio decided to start this business more than two years ago.  During that time, his business has grown, and he has made a name for himself with the high quality and delicious taste of his products.  Getulio feels that his business is profitable because it's easy to carry out and because he earns a good living.  In addition, he likes to relate to people and to strike up friendships with his regular customers.  Getulio earns a profit every day, which he invests again to earn more money.  He hopes to grow his business and produce a greater volume so he can sell wholesale to the small groceries in the settlements.  This is Getulio's third loan with MFP.  As such, he is grateful to all the people who make his financing possible and allow him to continue working toward his goals and planned growth.  In addition, he is certain that he will once again punctually repay his loan, just like he has with his previous loans.  Getulio is very thankful to be a client of MFP, as they offer him all the help he needs to keep moving forward. 
With the requested sum of 2000 nuevos soles (USD $800), Getulio will invest in the purchase of supplies, like banana bunches, cooking oil, bags, onions, lemons and other ingredients for making "chifles."  He will also purchase a load of firewood to be used in the stove where he fries the bananas.

loans.use: to purchase banana bunches, cooking oil, bags, onions, lemons and other ingredients.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Mr. Batbayar, 37 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an apartment near the city center. His wife has been teaching English at a high school for 10 years. Since 2009 he has been working as a human transporter on contract with a transportation business. The car he has been using has deteriorated over the years and is emitting environmentally harmful gasses. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 USD to purchase an environmentally friendly car that runs on natural gas. This loan directly benefits the family and efforts against air pollution. The family can generate more income, and the car they purchase will emit fewer gasses, contributing to environmental protection.

loans.use: to purchase an environmentally friendly car that runs on natural gas

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is married with one child. She lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Jovelyn is operating a food vending business to make a living and has had this business for three years. Each month she earns PHP 6,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more snack foods to sell. Jovelyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, with her income receipts, she will be able to pay for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more toys to resell

loans.name: Marlon Arley

texts.es: Marlon con su anterior credikiva compró juegos de videos novedosos y mejoró su competitividad; su inversión fue positiva porque permitió incrementar las ventas con un nuevo capital de trabajo para comprar lo que no había podido lograr anteriormente sin capital de crédito. En la actualidad está aplicada a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará nuevos video juegos, porque se acerca la temporada de vacaciones y niños y jóvenes son sus mejores clientes,  en especial si hay juegos mas modernos. Con ello su inversión de credikiva será muy exitosa porque son los mas grandes consumidores de sus productos en las épocas cuando se acerca la  navidad y la  noche buena.
texts.en: With his previous Kiva loan, Marlon bought up-to-date video games and improved his competitiveness.  His investment was a good one because it allowed sales to increase with new working capital so that he could buy what he had not been able to previously without capital credit.  The Kiva loan he is currently applying for will be used to buy new video games.  The holiday season is approaching and children and young people are his best clients, especially if the most current games are available.  Your investment in this Kiva loan will be very successful because customers purchase the most products when Christmas and Christmas Eve are approaching.

loans.use: to buy popular, new video games.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is from Dicoloc, Jimenez. She is 55 years old, widowed, and has three children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a lumber manufacturing business. Arlene has been engaged in her business for three years and earns 3,400 PHP a month. In 2008, Arlene joined GDMPC. Arlene is requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture new products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture lumber

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El señor Fernando ya ha tenido tres crédito con KIVA los cuales a pagado puntualmente y han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
Esta nuevamente solicitando su cooperación para este préstamo ya que necesita cambiar todo el cableado de la luz eléctrica de su vivienda ya que el que tiene actualmente esta en muy malas condiciones y quiere evitar algún falso contacto que pueda ocasionar un incendio a su casa.
El señor Fernando es empleado de la comisión de agua potable de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, en el aria de técnico con una parte del sueldo que recibe es para pagar el crédito ya que es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y que estén en las mejores condiciones y seguro para ellos.
texts.en:
Fernando has already had three loans with Kiva which he paid off on time. They were for home improvements. He is asking for your cooperation again with this loan, because he needs to change all of the electrical wiring in his house. The wiring he has now is in very poor condition and he wants to avoid any loose connection that could cause a fire in his house.  

Fernando works for the potable water commission in the city of Laredo in the technical area.  A part of his salary is for the loan, since it is the only source of income he has for his family. He wants to improve his family's property so it will be in better and safer condition for them.

loans.use: to change the electrical wiring.

loans.name: Yonisa

texts.en:
This is Yonisa. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yonisa hopes that her business will succeed and prosper. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor a 35-year-old woman living in Tabo-o, Jimenez. For three years, she has provided for the needs of her two children from the small sum of 6,000 PHP she has been earning monthly from her palay (rice) production business. Amor's business is an aid to the income her husband earns from farming. 

In 2008, Amor joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and she is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next cropping. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her palay (rice) production business.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina, de 41 años, es una mujer buena, honesta y muy amable, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos ya adultos, todos ellos viven en su casa propia que obtuvo con ayuda de su ex pareja.  La actividad principal de Saturnina consiste en la preparación de potajes y alimentos variados, ella posee éste gran don y es conocida como una de las mujeres que tiene la sazón más exquisita de su sector, es por eso que su modesto restaurante es uno de los más concurridos de la zona ya que sus clientes acuden a diario hacia ella para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara con tanto esmero y cariño. Actualmente el local donde trabaja es alquilado pero espera pronto contar con su propio establecimiento. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años con ayuda de su hija y una señora más. Complementa su actividad con la venta de bebidas gaseosas de diferentes marcas, precios y tamaños. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es preparar sus potajes, disfrutar de los aromas y sabores y saber que sus fieles comensales disfrutan de cada platillo que deleitan su paladar, es por eso que realiza su trabajo con mucho amor y entrega, aunque a veces siente que no puede complacer a todos de manera rápida como ella quisiera, espera continuar con el mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su restaurante e implementarlo con algunos detalles de menajería. Este es el crédito individual numero 7 con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado, además esta muy decidida a cumplir una vez más con sus pagos de manera puntual como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores, le agrada mucho ser cliente de la institución ya que le brindan todo el apoyo necesario para seguir adelante. Con los S/.4000 solicitados, comprará ingredientes que utiliza a diario para preparar los alimentos, ya que la demanda por su comida ha aumentado, además comprará utensilios de cocina como olla, platos y otros.
texts.en: Saturnina is 41 years old. She is a good, honest and kind woman. She is single and has 3 grown children. All of them live in the home she was able to buy with the help of her ex. Saturnina's main activity is making stews and various food. She has a great gift and is known as one of the best cooks in her area.  That is why her modest restaurant is one of the busiest in the area. Her customers go to her every day to try the delicious meals she prepares with so much hard work and affection. Right now, the locale where she works is rented, but she hopes to have her own establishment soon. She has been doing this activity for 4 years with the help of her daughter and another woman. She complements her activity by selling different brands, prices and sizes of soft drinks. What she likes the most about her job is making her stews, enjoying the aromas and flavors, knowing that her faithful customers enjoy every dish that delights their palates. That is why she does her job with so much love and dedication, though sometimes she feels she can't please everyone as quickly as she would like to. She hopes to continue improving the infrastructure of her restaurant and outfit it with utensils. This is her 7th individual loan with the MFP institution. She is grateful to all of the people who have made her loan possible so she can continue with her goals and growth she has planned. She is also very determined to make her payments on time once again like she did with the previous loans. She really likes being a client of the institution since they offer her all of the necessary support to get ahead. With the S/.4000 she has asked for, she will buy ingredients she uses daily to prepare the food, since the demand for her cooking has increased. She will also buy cooking utensils such as pots, plates and more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients she uses daily to prepare the food, as well as pots and plates.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 31 años, es una mujer muy empeñosa, amable y muy trabajadora, no tiene ninguna relación sentimental pero tiene tres hijos menores de edad con quienes vive y cuyas edades son 12, 8 y 4 años respectivamente, tiene su casa propia que pudieron construir gracias al resultado de su trabajo, comparte al lado de toda su familia muchos días de inacabables alegrías y de continuo esfuerzo por salir adelante. El trabajo de Mercedes consiste en la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, ella se encarga con suma paciencia de elaborar las prendas que sus clientes le solicitan a pedido principalmente lencería femenina pero también elabora de manera particular y con frecuencia algunas prendas que ella personalmente diseña. Se dedica a esta recién un año, siempre ha trabajado sola y afirma que nunca tuvo algún reclamo por parte de sus clientes. Está muy tranquila porque sabe que su trabajo le permite generar sus propios ingresos económicos con los que brinda todas las comodidades que sus hijos necesitan. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar en un prenda el diseño en que se inspira, la facilidad que tiene de crear algo nuevo la coloca como una de las mejores costureras de la ciudad, se siente útil siempre, aunque asegura que no le agrada mucho elaborar pantalones de varón por el tiempo y la dificultad que le demanda; espera pronto construir un taller de costura mucho mas grande y destinar un espacio únicamente destinado a la venta de sus creaciones. Este es el préstamo grupal número 1 con MFP, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir incrementado su negocio, esta convencida que será una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes y licra.
texts.en: Mercedes is a 31-year-old woman who is very dedicated, friendly and hardworking. She is single and lives with her three children aged 4, 8 and 12. She has her own house, which she was able to build as a result of her hard work. She shares many days of endless joy with her family, and together they strive to build a better life. Her work consists of making clothing for men, women and children. She has utmost patience as she makes these clothes on order from her customers. She mostly makes women's lingerie but also makes other items, and often personally designs her own clothing. She has been doing this for one year. She has always worked on her own and affirms that she has never had a complaint from her customers. She is very happy because she knows that her work enables her to generate her own income, which allows her to bring her children everything they need. What she likes about her work is that she can express herself in her own designs that inspire her. The ease with which she creates something new has distinguished her as one of the best seamstresses in the city, and she always feels that she is making an impact. (However, she makes it clear that she does not much enjoy making pants for men, due to the difficulty of this activity.) Soon she hopes to build a much larger sewing shop and dedicate a space solely to her own designs. This is her group's first loan with MFP. She is grateful to those who are making this loan possible; she needs the loan in order to keep growing her business. She is confident that she will be a very punctual client and make her loan repayments on time. With the funds solicited (1,000 nuevos soles), she will buy sewing materials such as cloth, thread, elastic, lace and lycra.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, elastic, lycra and lace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Palomitas” es un grupo conformado por 07 socias entusiastas que pasan a su 6to ciclo. María de  42 años, casada con 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Ella se dedica al  comercio de la compra y venta de ropas para niños y adultos, la cual trabaja sobre pedido, pues por el momento no cuenta con un local donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas. Comenzó de ayudante de productos de belleza para luego convertirse en una buena vendedora, junto a su pareja han logrado darle educación a sus hijos y comprarse una mototaxi la cual lo trabaja unos de sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es de comprarse su propia casa. Su reciente crédito lo destinará para la  compra de prendas por temporada como faldas, polos, blusas, y chores. Agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada.    María se encuentra sentada y está ubicada al medio viste polo negro.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Palomitas” is comprised of seven enthusiastic members who are currently in their sixth loan cycle.

One member is María, who is 42 years old and married with four children, one of whom is still living at home.  María buys and sells clothing on order for adults and children.  At the moment she does not have a permanent location from which she can sell her products.  She started out as an assistant helping to sell beauty products, but later became a skilled salesperson.  She and her husband have been able to provide an education to their children and purchase a mototaxi, which one of their children uses for work.  

Her main goal is to buy her own house.  The current loan will enable her to purchase seasonal clothing such as skirts, polo shirts and blouses.  She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.  In the photo she is sitting in the middle and wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, tiene 36 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos quienes aun son menores y recientemente dio a luz a su ultima bebé, todos dependen de ella y su pareja para poder tener una buena calidad de vida, viven en una casa propia como una familia muy unida y trabajadora.
El trabajo de Mónica, consiste en la venta de golosinas, su puesto está ubicado en su propia casa, es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que está muy bien situada en su barrio, ella es muy conocida por su buen humor y carisma, lo cual ha hecho que sus ventas le den los ingresos económicos que requiere; la necesidad de ser independiente y los gastos familiares que ha diario tenía que cubrir fueron los motivos principales que le llevaron a desarrollar éste trabajo, lleva ya casi 4 años en ésta actividad, al principio sentía que era muy tímida para hacerlo pero con el tiempo pudo desarrollar sus cualidades y ahora vende mucho y está muy contenta por eso.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y hacerlos reír, considera que lo más difícil es tener que vender bajo los fuertes rayos solares de la mañana, le encantaría tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000), comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de empezar a implementar su puesto con algunos abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mónica is 36 years old. She is a good, kind, and very hardworking woman. She lives together with her partner, with whom she has three children who are still minors; she recently gave birth to her last baby. They all depend on her and her partner to give them a good quality of life. They live in their own house; they are a very united and hardworking family.

Mónica earns her living selling snacks. Her stand is located at her house. It's very busy, since her stand is well-situated in the neighborhood. She is well known for her good disposition and charisma, which has enabled her sales to provide the income they need. The need to be independent and the daily household expenses that she had to cover were the main motivations that led her to develop her business. She has run her stand for almost four years. In the beginning, she felt very intimidated by starting a business, but with time she was able to develop her skills; now she sells a lot and is happy about that.

What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers and making them laugh. She thinks the hardest part is having to sell out in the strong morning sun. She would love to have a snack shop where she could sell in greater comfort and offer a better variety of products to her customers.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, so she thanks those who make her loan possible so that she can continue toward her objectives. She is once again very committed to repaying her loan on time, as she did with the previous loans that she has had. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank because all its members are very good, kind, people who are supportive of each other.

With the requested money, she will buy a larger quantity of snacks to offer to her customers. In addition, she will begin to stock her stand with some groceries.

loans.use: to buy a variety of snacks and everyday household products for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: La Ilusion De Cholchol Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Las Ilusiones de Chol Chol” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de zapatos, repostería, venta de ají merken (condimento para las comidas), venta de estructuras metálicas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la Ciudad de Temuco.
Nancy, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste polera de color nagra con flores, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica la rubro de venta de ropa para el hogar desde hace 3 años. Comenta que ofrece sabanas, cobertores, plumones, toallas, manteles, en los domicilios de su clientela, su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago, ya que encuentra gran variedad y calidad en los productos para la casa a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará sabanas, manteles, toallas.
Una de las metas de Nancy es continuar en su rubro y poder tener un local donde pueda ofrecer su mercadería a su clientela, así generar mayores ingresos y aportar con los gastos familiares y darle lo mejor a su hija.
Nancy vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 19 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral tener un negocio más grande donde siga ofreciendo ropa y además incluir articulos para el hogar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos y existe una muy buena comunicación.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Ilusiones de Chol Chol”. It is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different areas. Among them are: selling clothes, selling shoes, pastries, selling merken peppers (a food condiment), selling metallic structures, services and more. All of them live in the city of Temuco.

Nancy is a member of the communal bank. In the photo she is standing in the first row, second from the right. She is wearing a black shirt with flowers. Her hair is dark brown and it is loose. She has sold linens for 3 years. She says that she sells sheets, bedspreads, comforters, towels, and tablecloths at her customers' homes. Her schedule is according to her availability.

She buys the merchandise and materials that she needs in the city of Santiago, because there is a lot of variety and quality of home products at a low price, so it works out financially. With the loan, she will buy sheets, tablecloths, and towels. One of Nancy's goals is to continue working in this areas and be able to have a locale where she can offer her merchandise to her customers. This way, she will generate more income and contribute for the family expenses and give her daughter the best.  

Nancy lives with her 19 year old daughter. Her work dreams are to have a bigger locale where she can keep offering linens and other articles for the home. She is very happy for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable with the group she participates in, since they are close and there is good communication.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). Nearby are a series of lake beaches (Pucón, Villarrica) and very striking native flora and fauna concentrated in the nearby natural parks. It is worth noting that in this region lives 50% of the Mapuches, an indigenous people from our country.

loans.use: to buy sheets, tablecloths and towels.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a 29-year-old, married woman from Loboc, Bohol. She has one child, a two year old daughter. Rosalie has been engaged in the hog-raising or piggery business for five years. This is where she gets her income to supply their daily needs. Her husband also does carpentry.

Rosalie is requesting a loan to buy piglets to be sold. Through this loan, Rosalie will be able to raise pigs in her house and create more income.

In the future, Rosalie dreams of expanding her business and becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy piglets for resale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
From Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Evangeline is 45 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, she has operated a business buying and selling fish for four years, earning PHP 3,000 a month.

Evangeline, who joined GDMPC in 2008, is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Françis

texts.fr: Françis est un homme de 38 ans célibataire, sans enfant .Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite parfumerie qu'il gère depuis un an déjà. Il a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'il achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Il sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le futur.
texts.en: Françis is a 38 year old single man without any children. He is a trader and he manages a small cosmetics store that he opened a year ago. He often has problems due to a lack of cosmetics, weaves and extensions in his store because he buys his products retails. His aim is to satisfy his customers and make a good profit. He is requesting a loan to buy material in large quantities so that he can achieve his objectives. He will use the profit he gains from this loan to satisfy his needs and his family's needs. He will put the rest into savings so that he can grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to increase his stock of cosmetics (i.e. lotions, gels), weaves and extensions

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco, 70 has been farming cacao for 20 years. Together with his wife Brigida, Francisco has raised seven children and helped bring up an innumerable number of grandchildren – literally, he couldn’t say how many there were. He lives with Brigida and their grandson Mark, who just graduated high school with a major in agriculture, and kindly helped translate in the gathering of this information. Francisco's native language is Maya Mopan. 

Francisco is in the process of transferring his profound knowledge accumulated during 20 years of farming cacao, the sole source of income for his family, to his grandson. Like many of his peers, Mark is faced with the choice between farming and scarcely available employment in town. Mark says he wants to expand the scope of Francisco's farm to introduce some fresh vegetables, and to experiment with making and applying organic fertilizer. He also hopes to utilize his experience in food processing by using the fresh veg to make products that are not available locally. 

By being able to include his grandson in the ranks of hired help to assist with cleaning and pruning this season, Francisco will invest in the farm while also making a human capital investment to provide opportunity for his grandson to explore farm-related forms of sustenance. Cleaning and pruning is a key investment when it comes to cacao as it eases access to the trees for harvesting, prevents spread of mold infestation and increases yields in the coming harvest season.

loans.use: To clean and prune 5 acres of cacao farm in preparation for the 2013 harvest season.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe, 58, lives with his wife, son, and grandson. He’s been growing cacao for most of his adult life - 30 years. “I like farmers. We have to work otherwise we don’t have anything. It’s hard, but it’s a farmer’s life,” says Felipe. 

Beside cacao, Felipe also receives income from corn sold at the Punta Gorda market, one hour down the road from San Jose, as well as beans and yams sold locally. He has used this money to invest in one of few solar panels in the village of San Jose, Toledo District, which is not connected to the grid due to poor road access. The solar panel is hooked to a battery and an inverter to provide electricity for stable phone use and light. What helped Felipe beat his peers in installing electricity in the home? “I never neglect anything,” he says, and lives by it. 

Felipe will use the loan to invest in cleaning his cacao plots. Cleaning means cutting the underbrush to clear access to the trees for pruning and harvesting and is fundamental in preventing spread of mold in the rainy season. Cacao farms located in lowland tropical forest require cleaning every 3-4 months. 

An entrepreneur at heart, Felipe is all about diversifying his crops and is one of few farmers to grow fresh vegetables – cabbage, tomato and peppers among others on his farm. Why diversify? “Corn is just not tasty without the pepper sauce to go with it,” he told us in perfect English – his second language after Maya Mopan.

loans.use: To hire help to clean 4 acres of cacao farm.

loans.name: Catarino

texts.en:
An experienced farmer, and relatively new to cacao, Catarino planted his first two acres in 2000. Having expanded to another plot of four acres in 2005, he now manages among the biggest farms in Maya Mountain Cacao's network. Catarino lives in the village of San Jose with his wife Isidora and two kids, with another four already living outside the home. 

Farming has been Catarino’s bread and butter since the beginning of days. “Farming is my life. I have no education other than my farm,” he says proudly. His wife Isidora helps out with the farm, primarily with harvesting, fermentation and drying. Catarino is one of few farmers that prefers to manage the processing before passing it onto buyers, and sells as much as 500 lbs of dry cacao and probably double that in wet cacao yearly. 

A true enthusiast of working the land, Catarino says farming is not that hard. “You have no boss, you’re your own boss.” Having no help around the farm, as his older children work in a nearby shrimp farm and youngest are still infants, Catarino is used to hiring help to manage to clean and prune his cacao farm. Pruning and cleaning is a key investment when it comes to cacao, as it eases access to the trees for harvesting, prevents spread of mold infestation and increases yields in the coming harvest season. As many farmers in San Jose, Catarino speaks his native Maya Mopan as well as English.

loans.use: To hire help with cleaning, pruning and harvesting his six acre cacao farm and purchase a cleaning blade.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael, 45, is a father of 12 children, with the youngest aged 2 and oldest aged 25. Like about a third of farmers in the Maya Mountain Cacao network, Rafael lives in the village of San Jose, in the district of Toledo, where he’s been farming 4 acres of cacao for twenty years. 

Cacao is the sole source of income for Rafael's family, and his favorite crop because it has a market. “The problem is you cannot do a lot, because poor farmers don’t have finance to invest [in their farms]. That’s why we’re looking for loans,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao. Rafael's first loan will go towards cleaning, which for cacao farmers means removing the underbrush in order to plant new seedlings, prepare for pruning or harvesting by opening pathways and access to the trees. 

Rafael recently expanded the scope of his cacao farm by transplanting – moving seedlings from bags into the ground – 300 trees. Planting new seedlings is a long-term investment, as cacao trees take 3-5 years to start producing pods. 

Investment in the farm facilitated by loans translates to investment in his children, 5 of whom are currently enrolled in school. Besides taking the kids away from helping around the farm, school in Belize has annual tuition costs that are prohibitive for many Maya farmers in Toledo. Rafel's older kids followed his example by taking up cacao farming themselves.

loans.use: To hire help with cleaning his farm of almost 1,000 cacao trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in cleaning his 2 acres and helping his sons clean their plots.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso 72, lives in the village of San Jose with his wife Isabela and two children. Asked to recount how many children he has, Alfonso counts studiously naming different villages where they all live. 

Alfonso has been farming for 30 years, and works one of the bigger cacao farms in the area, spread out in 3 plots encompassing 4 acres and around 1,600 producing trees. One of the most productive families in the Maya Mountain Cacao network, Alfonso’s farm has been under constant expansion. “The happiest moments are when the trees are producing well and we have you guys here buying every weekend,” Alfonso told MMC, adding that on the few occasions when there’s no production to sell it really feels like he’s losing out, but that’s cacao. There’s money to be made in cacao, and if everything goes perfect and he manages to keep the diseases in check, he says he’ll be a rich man.  

Alfonso is getting ready for cleaning the underbrush surrounding his cacao trees before the upcoming harvest season. Cacao pod production is picking up slowly and will reach full swing in March-April and continue until it slows again In July-August. Cleaning is a routine activity on shade-grown cacao farms in tropical lowlands and needs to be repeated every three to four months. It is necessary to clear access to the trees for pruning, harvesting and or planting new seedlings as well as to prevent fungus diseases common in the rainy season. 

Alfonso got introduced to cacao when his father started planting even before the big push in the industry when Hershey’s arrived to Belize in the early 90’s and introduced a new market and seed varietals from Costa Rica.

loans.use: To hire help with cleaning his 3 plots of cacao in preparation for the upcoming harvest season.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.en:
Eladio boasts an exemplary family, household and farm. Eladio and his wife Virginia have brought up 15 children, of which the youngest Jahir will turn 5 in January and oldest, Adalia, is 34. Add to that some 13 grandchildren and spouses of the 10 live-in kids and you can picture this famous family from San Pedro Columbia. 

Most westerners have a hard time even imagining anything past a couple of children, but Eladio and Virginia have embraced each without fail and have worked out parenting to an art. Visitors from around the world have been visiting this beautiful family and their farm since they started a sustainable tourism enterprise. “It’s lucky to meet my brothers and sisters around the world just through a little garden,” Eladio says enthusiastically. Most of the family is trilingual, as Eladio comes from a Mopan Maya speaking environment and Virginia's background is Q'eqchi', and everybody also speaks English on top of the two Maya tongues. 

Beside cacao, they grow more exotic crops like mango, coconut, ginger, lemongrass and Jamaican lime. “I grow whatever the birds or the agouti [type of rodent]bring. That’s how an agouti works. I keep stashing the seeds also,” Eladio assures us with a huge smile. The 31-acre farm has been key in sustaining the numerous family and also served as a source of learning for the family and now visitors from abroad. Eladio and Virginia’s farm is a prime example of integrated farming, where timber and fruit trees abound in harmony and soil is enriched by composting underbrush cleared for pathways to access the crop. Integrated farming brings opportunities for soil enrichment, but also means more work cleaning, pruning and raking the underbrush to transform it to compost. Regular cleaning is indispensable for cacao farms on tropical lowlands as good soil, rain and shade make for prime conditions for growth. “Everybody wants to be a student these days. I want my kids to be farmers,” says Eladio.

loans.use: To hire help to clean 15 acres of cacao and rake cleaned underbrush for compost.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago, 53, and his wife Margarita live in the village of Indian Creek, close to the highway connecting southern Belize to the ex capital of Belize City. Road infrastructure means connection to the electric grid, but also higher expenses due to power bills.

Santiago, a father of six, lives with his wife and their youngest, a 17-year-old son. Having initially tried to manage a teaching job alongside farming, he opted to join the ranks of many farmers making their land their full-time job and are looking sustain their families by tapping into new markets for cash crops. To diversify his income stream, Santiago has kept his eyes and ears open about different market opportunities, this has led him to expand to pumpkin, a high-demand crop on the neighboring Guatemala market. Moreover, there is pre-harvest financing for pumpkin, whereas until now there were virtually no financing mechanisms in place for cacao farmers. Santiago has been investing his income in home improvement and diversifying his food supply, such as his recently installed small-scale tilapia ponds.

Cacao farming has proved to be risky business for Santiago, whose crop was devastated by Hurricane Iris in 2001, and again in 2007 by a fire that spread from a neighboring farm. Persistent in his efforts, however, he replanted every time, and even transplanted 500 new seedlings in September of 2012 to expand his cacao farm, which has 30-year-old trees. Cacao trees take three to five years to begin producing pods and continue at full capacity for 60-70 years. Farmers have to routinely clean and prune their cacao trees to ease access for harvesting, prevent spread of mold infestation and increase yields in the coming harvest season.

loans.use: To clean his cacao farm of close to 1,000 mature trees and 500 seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nicodème Alain

texts.fr: Alain est un homme de 30 ans marié, père de trois enfants.Il est agriculteur. il sème les semences pour les revendre en petites plantes dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 6 ans. son activité fonctionne à merveille. il a juste un problème dû à la petitesse de son capital de lui permet pas d'acheter assez de semences pour planter d'où la nécessité de ce crédit qui l'aidera son stock de semences. Il économisera une partie de ses bénéfices pour son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Alain is a 30 year old married man who has three children. He is a farmer. He has been planting seeds and selling the seedlings in a district of the capital for 6 years. His business is going really well. He has just one problem caused by his limited capital that does not allow him to buy enough seed for planting. This is why he is seeking a loan that will help him increase his stock of seed. He will set aside a portion of his profits for his business and he will use the rest to take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: To increase his stock of seed packets

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent (pictured with one of his dairy cows though requesting  for a loan to venture into poultry farming) is aged thirty-eight and a farmer in Kitale county, Kenya, where he lives with his husband and six children, who are all in school, he has been in farming for the past twelve years producing maize, beans, vegetables and milk which he sells at the local market in his local area.

He is requesting for  30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds, from which he will get more produce and use the money to uplift his livelihood and pay for his children's schooling. He aspires to be the leading supplier of poultry products in his local area.

Vincent appreciates the way Juhudi Kilimo is efficient in processing loans.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase piglets and renovate the barn

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is 55 years old, a widow and a and mother to her children. She lives in Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She works hard to manage her variety store and continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store where groceries, toiletries, and beverages are sold in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP of cooking oil, or an egg. Liza buys her supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Norberta is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to help continue to operate her business and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income with her loan.

She hopes that her children will have a good life and she dreams of expanding her business. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Estelle Lydie

texts.fr: Estelle Lydie est âgée de 30ans. Mariée et mère de deux enfants dont l'aîné est scolarisé. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 6ans et 3ans. Elle vend des pagnes, des chaussures et des pommades corporelles depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Dans le but d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Estelle Lydie a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en: Estelle Lydia is 30 years old. She is married and mother to two children who are 6 years old and 3 years old. The eldest is in school. She has been selling pagnes (traditional fabrics), shoes and body ointments for several years and gets her supplies from one of the markets outside Benin. In order to increase her turnover and better meet customer demand, Estelle Lydie has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev with a view to maximizing profit and contributing to the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (traditional fabrics), 12 body ointments et 10 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a 30-year-old, married woman from Bohol, Philippines and a mother of two young children. She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for more than seven years. This is the source of their daily income.

Jona is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat. With this loan, they will be able to improve their catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Jona dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Maria Nenita

texts.en:
This is Maria Nenita, 62, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Maria Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

She also sells fish of different kinds and also meat. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria Nenita hopes to expand her business and dreams of being able to save money and have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
This is Ma. Victoria, 50, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Riconvivo, her business partner, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Victoria operates a buy and sell business. She buys large amounts of foam, makes them into foam beds of different sizes and then sells them. Buying from her is a lot cheaper than buying in malls, and that's why she is being patronized by her neighbors and the local community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of foam needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Victoria dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of foam needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 42, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ceriaco, a safety officer, and  is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alma hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life and becoming rich for her family’s sake. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Cielva Maria

texts.es: Cielva Maria accedió anteriormente a un crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que compró víveres, ranchos, refrescos y bebidas, además de carnes y pollo en mayor volumen. Su negocio de venta de alimentos iniciado desde el año 2006, ha crecido poco a poco y esto es gracias a los financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que la ha apoyado en su ascenso. Hoy Cielva  está solicitando un primer credikiva,  con el cual comprará arroz, aceite, pollo y un mesón,  para elaborar sus productos  con más comodidad y eficacia. Se acercan las navidades y el año nuevo y los pasteles de Cielva se venden mucho más y por esta razón su capital de trabajo le resulta insuficiente, para atender la demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará arroz, verduras, carnes, hojas de bijao, pitas etc. Con los ricos pasteles sorprenderá a su clientela que no tendrán que cocinar durante las festividades, porque encontraran en el negocio de  Sielva Maria todo lo que están buscando y muy fácilmente.
texts.en: Cielva Maria previously received a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she purchased supplies, like food supplies, sodas and beverages as well as large quantities of meats and chicken.  She started her business selling food in 2006.  Her business has grown bit by bit thanks to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loans, which have helped her in her ascent.  Today, Cielva is requesting her first Kiva loan, with which she will purchase rice, cooking oil, chicken and a counter so she can make her products more comfortably and efficiently.  Christmas and the New Year are approaching, and Cielva will sell a lot more pastries during the holiday season.  But her working capital is insufficient to meet the demand.  And that is the reason she is requesting her first Kiva loan, with which she will purchase rice, vegetables, meats, bijao leaves (leaves from a local, tropical plant that food is cooked inside of), pitas etc.  Cielva will so surprise her customers with her delicious pastries, that they won't have to cook during the holiday season.  Because they will have easily found, in Cielva Maria's business, everything they are looking for.

loans.use: to purchase rice, vegetables, meats, bijao leaves (leaves from a local, tropical plant that food is cooked inside of) and pitas

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married with four children. She is 42 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Alice owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting rice to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns 7,000 PHP each month. 

She requested a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the costs of planting rice. Alice has been a member of Kiva's partner, Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) since 2010. In the future, Alice hopes to expand her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the costs of planting rice on her farm.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y con deseos de superación, así como también es amable y cordial. Es separada del padre de sus 3 hijos, pero tiene una nueva relación buscando rehacer su vida. Vive en compañía de su actual pareja  y sus 3 hijos, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa, que construyó con su anterior pareja. La actividad que realiza Carmen es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Tiene planes de comprar 2 maquinas de coser para empezar con el negocio, la cual instaló en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a sus clientes quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados, logrando ganar  su preferencia, luego ellos la recomiendan con otras personas, quienes se convierten en sus clientes habituales. Actualmente cuenta con 3 maquinas de coser que fue comprando con sus ganancias y prestamos anteriores con MFP.
Lleva realizando éste oficio hace más de  4 años, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando ella sola.
Considera a su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio ya que puede desempeñarse en el oficio que le gusta, la costura, que le valió para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, quienes son  su mayor motivación para seguir esforzándose. Pero comenta le incomoda un poco el cansancio físico por estar sentada en una misma postura que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e instalar un pequeño taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir en su casa. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea continuar con éste apoyo, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra  materiales para la confección de lencerías como telas, hilos, y demás, buscará precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera tendrá mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen, 42, is a cheerful woman who very much wants to improve; she’s also kind and gracious.  She’s separated from the father of her three children but she’s in a new relationship seeking to rebuild her life.  She lives with her current partner and her three children comfortably in her own house that she built with her ex-spouse.  

Carmen’s activity is sewing, an occupation she learned at an occupational education center.  She plans to buy two sewing machines to start the business she set up at home where she tends to customers who seek her out because of the good quality of her work; this is how she wins them over.  Then they recommend her to other people who become her regular customers.  She currently has three sewing machines that she bought with her profits and with prior MFP loans.  She’s been in this business for more than four years and to date has been doing it along.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the good profits it yields.

She likes her business because she can do what she enjoys, sewing, and it has served to cover her household expenses and to pay for her children’s schooling who are her greatest motivation to continue striving forward.  She comments though that the physical exhaustion does cause her some concern because she must remain seated in the same position and this causes her back pain but she does not become discouraged and continues working and striving.

She therefore has plans to expand the business and install a small sewing workshop to make clothing at home.  This will be MFP loan #6 and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s been getting and wants to continue with it so she commits to make her payments like she’s done previously.

She will use the requested 1,200 new soles to buy sewing supplies like fabric and thread to make lingerie; she will seek out the lowest prices for volume purchases so her profits will be higher.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer  trabajadora y empeñosa, además  de ser amable y religioso.  Es conviviente  con Rony quien se dedica al comercio y es padre de sus 6 hijos a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación. Vive en compañía de su pareja  e hijos, habitando su propia casa que logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja. La actividad que realiza Celia  es la venta de mercadería variada como ropas, zapatos, sandalias, pasamanerías y otro. Todos estos productos los compra en los centros comerciales de la localidad, y los vende en los caseríos ubicados a la rivera de los ríos, realizando viajes periódicos a esa zona.  Ofreciendo y vendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes
Este negocio viene funcionando desde hace 05  años, iniciándose con un capital propio  luego fue creciendo con préstamos de MFP, con el apoyo de su pareja en la comercialización de sus productos.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y el lograr vender todo el producto que lleva por los caseríos.
Le gusta su actividad ya que la mantienen  ocupada, y le permite visitar a su madre que vive en el caserío que visita, gracias a ello le genera un ingreso económico para solventara sus gastos propios y la educación de sus hijos a quienes quiere mucho. Pero comenta que es un negocio con bastante desgaste físico y no le permite estar el tiempo suficiente con sus hijos. Por tal motivo desea dejar negocio e incursionar en otro, pero desde la comodidad de su casa como una tienda de comestibles. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 09 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio. Por tal motivo se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra mercadería variada para llevarlo por os caseríos, como linternas, pilas, ropas, productos de belleza y otros, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras al contando, así tendrá un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Celia, 42, is a hardworking, dedicated woman in addition to being kind and gracious.  She lives with Rony who is a merchant and father of their six children who she loves very much and are her motivating force.  She lives with her spouse and children in her house that she and her spouse built.  Celia’s activity is selling varied merchandise like clothes, shoes, sandals, notions and others.  She buys all her merchandise in local shopping centers and sells them in settlements along river banks making periodic trips to that zone to kindly offer and sell to her customers.  The business has been in operation five years having started it with capital of her own and then growing with MFP loans and with her spouse’s help with the sales.  She considers it to be quite profitable because of the good profits it yields and because she manages to sell out everything she takes to the settlements.

She likes her activity because it keeps her busy and allows her to visit her mother who lives in the settlement she visits.  Thanks to it she generates income to cover her own expenses and her children’s schooling who she loves very much.  She comments though that this business is quite physically demanding and does not leave her enough time to spend with her children.  Because of this, she’s planning to leave this business and go into a new one but something she can do from the comfort of home like a grocery store.  

This will be MFP loan #9.  She feels grateful for the financial support she’s been getting to advance with her business and because of that she commits to be responsible with her installment payments like she’s been previously.  Also, she feels comfortable in her communal bank because the members are responsible people.  She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy varied merchandise like flashlights, batteries, clothes and beauty products to take to the settlements seeking out the lowest prices for cash purchases in order to have stock available for sale.

loans.use: to buy flashlights, batteries, clothes and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Nikki

texts.en:
Nikki is 43 years old and she is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental.  She is married and has one child. 

To earn a living, Nikki runs a general store.  She has been in business for four years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP each month.  Nikki is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.  

Nikki joined GDMPC in 2010.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Sylvie Cécile

texts.fr: Agée de 41ans, Sylvie Cécile est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Les deux enfants ont respectivement 17ans et 06ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des pagnes depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Sylvie Cécile, pour faute de moyens financiers, a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev en vue de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son revenu additionnel et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle souhaiterait agrandir son commerce afin de devenir une grossiste.
texts.en: Sylvie Cécile is a 41 year old married woman who has two children in school. The two children are 17 years old and 6 years old. She has been specializing in the sale of pagnes (traditional cloths) for several years and gets her supplies from one of the markets outside Benin. Due to a lack of financial means, Sylvie Cécile has requested and obtained a loan from the microfinance insitution Finadev with a view to strengthening her revenues and meeting the needs of her customers. This loan will enable her to maximize additional income and contribute to the education of her children. She hopes to expand her business with a view to becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy 30 pagnes (traditional cloths)

loans.name: Tulibamu Group

texts.en:
Lucy is divorcee aged 38 years with three children aged 16, 14 and 6. She takes care of all the needs of her children; that is to say feeding, shelter, medical, paying school fees among others.

Lucy sells fresh food (tomatoes, cassava ,carbages) in Kagadi market. She started this business in 2008 in order to get money look after her children after divorcing with her husband. Lucy has requested for a loan so that she can buy more fresh groceries to meet the increasing demand and also increase her family earnings to cater for her children.

Her future dream is to see the business grow bigger from the current size and being able to educate her children. She also hopes to construct a permanent residential house for the family. Lucy's major challenge is the perishability of her food supplies and limited capital in the business to meet the increasing demand.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods and vegetables

loans.name: Happy Friends Development Group

texts.en:
