texts.en: This group is called Mohammed, and consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Sabah is a 35 year old married woman who has 8 children. She has been selling different products like perfumes, clothes, etc. for many years. She started her business with a small amount of capital, and has been able to improve it. She would like to expand her business, so she has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy perfumes, clothes, etc. for her business. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, clothes, etc. for her business

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
This is Angeles.  She previously borrowed 9,000 PHP that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP in order to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business.  Her profits from this business will help her to meet her daily needs and pay for her children’s educational expenses.  She looks forward to this financial gain with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angeles dreams that her children will finish their studies and hopes to expand her business.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
This is Lucita. She previously accessed a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better, because more items to sell will result in increased profits. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucita wants to have a vacation in other countries and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en: Imaculada is 35 years old. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $ 70.  She earns a good income from her business.  She is now applying for a loan of $ 1,000 to improve it by buying some items to stock in her store such as body lotion, soft drinks, beer, noodles, and rice. She is a very hard-working woman and running this business has become her regular activity for the past 12 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, soft drinks, beer, noodles, and rice.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Valentina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Valentina is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through the Negro Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy materials for the repair of the boat she uses in her fishing business.

Valentina has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Cirila Francisca

texts.es:
Cirila es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de 3 hijos y  cada día trabaja muy duro para poder darles una vida digna y sobre todo llena de amor. La vivienda de cirila se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual se caracteriza por recibir a muchos turistas durante todo el año, quienes quedan maravillados por las líneas de Nazca. Debido a su pocos recursos económicos Cirila solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera encantado tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Cirila trabaja como obrera agrícola, ella labora alrededor de 6 horas  al día mayormente, pero cuando es temporada de cosecha puede trabajar más horas, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable con su trabajo y por ello siempre la contratan.

Cirila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha  brindado ella podrá realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su domicilio ya que actualmente solo usaba velas para poder ver en las noches; de esta manera ella podrá mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble ya que actualmente es de adobe”
texts.en:
Cirila is a very hardworking woman.  She's the mother of three children and she works very hard every day to be able to give them a decent life filled with love.  Cirila's home is in the city of Nazca, known for being visited year round by a lot of tourists, who marvel at the Nazca lines.

Owing to a lack of financial resources, Cirila only finished the fifth year of secondary education, but she would love to have studied in the university.

Cirila works as a farmworker every day.  She works around six hours a day normally, but during the harvest she can work more.  She believes it's going well for her in her job because she's very responsible, so she always gets hired.

Cirila's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to install electricity in her home.  Currently she uses only candles to be able to see at night.  This way she'll improve her family's quality of life and continue striving to make her biggest dream come true: "To finish building her home of quality material because currently it's made of adobe."

loans.use: to install electricity in her house

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es una mujer de 59 años, quien es madre de 7 hijos de los cuales el ultimo de ellos tienen 19 años y a quien apoya muchísimo porque aun se encuentra en la universidad.  Junto a su esposo trabajan muy duro ya que con el fruto de su trabajo pueden solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar.

Día a día Pascuala trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella día a día ofrece sus productos en el mercado de su ciudad y en ocasiones ofrece de casa en casa a los vecinos de su barrio; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo  porque es responsable y luchadora.

Pascuala esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su clientes y de esta manera seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Que sus hijos tengan una profesión y mejorar su calidad de Vida.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a 59-year-old woman with 7 children.  Her youngest child is 19, and she helps him a lot because he is in college. She and her husband work very hard to pay for their home expenses.

Each day, Pascuala works in her small business selling clothes.  She offers her products daily in the city market and on occasion goes door-to-door, selling to her neighbors.  She believes that her business does well because she is friendly with her clients and, above all, she is responsible and hardworking.

Pascuala is very grateful for the Kiva loans, since thanks to their help she has been able to buy merchandise for her clients.  In this way, she has been able to continue fighting to achieve her greatest dream: that her children will have a profession and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армен  родился  1972г. в  городе Капане  и живет там по сей день. Армен  по специальности экономист и окончил   Ереванский институт народного хозяйства.
Армен  женат , имеет  дочь и сына которым по 11 и 13 лет .Жена Армена имеет собственный магазин где продает одежду и женские аксессуары. 
Сельскохозяйственным бизнесом Армен и его семья занимаются  почти 10 лет. У семьи Армена есть земельный участок в Капане где выращивают овощи и фрукты. 
Сельскохозяйственную продукцию Армен реализует в Капане и у него за эти годы уже есть множество постоянных клиентов. 
Как говорит Армен - сельскохозяйственный бизнес тяжелый труд но прибыльный , по его словам надо любить землю, чтоб она вознаградила тебя за твой тяжкий труд. 
Армену нужен кредит на сумму 500.000 Арм. драмм  для покупки сетки для ограждения огорода, а также для бетонных работ в огороде.
texts.en:
Armen was born in 1972 in the city of Kapan and still lives there.  Armen is an economist by profession and graduated from the Yerevan Institute of National Economy.  Armen is married and has a daughter and son who are 11 and 13 years old.  Armen's wife has her own store where she sells clothing and women's accessories.  

Armen and his family have been in the agriculture business for nearly 10 years.  Armen's family owns a wonderful plot of land in Kapan where they grow vegetables and fruits.  Armen sells his agricultural products in Kapan and he has had a lot of regular customers over the years.  

As Armen says the agriculture business is difficult work but profitable, according to him you need to love the land so that it rewards you for your hard work.

Armen needs a loan of 500,000 Arm. dram to purchase netting for garden fencing and for concrete work in the garden.

loans.use: to buy netting for his garden fence and to do concrete work in the garden

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 40-year-old businessman, married to Lucy, and their marriage is blessed with children. He runs a stationery shop as his primary business and also does mixed farming with the support of his wife as their secondary business. 

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by another existing customer. Julius plans to use part of the loan amount to buy more textbooks, notes, pencils, ballpoint pens, etc. for sale in his stationery shop while the rest will be used to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting on his farm.

loans.use: To buy textbooks, notes, pencils, ballpoint pens, etc

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
16 amigas de la ciudad de Luque se han unido para poder ayudarse y también poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo en conjunto.
La Sra. Blanca esta acompañada con el señor Juan , tiene 3 hijas. Ella  se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas de de hace ya un buen y gracias a la buena calidad de las prendas que tiene se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela. Su meta es seguir creciendo y esforzándose, ya que todo lo que ella hace es por sus hijas, ya que quiere que ellas el día de mañana sean personas de bien, útiles a la sociedad.
Ella acude a kiva y fundación para pedir un préstamo para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, para seguir vendiéndolas y así tener los ingresos que necesita para seguir ayudando en la casa, y a su marido con los gastos del día a día.
texts.en:
Sixteen friends in the city of Luque have united to be able to help one another and to also help their families through working together.  

Blanca is in a relationship with Juan, and she has three daughters.  She makes a living selling used clothing and thanks to the good quality of the clothing that she has, she has done well and has great customers.  Her goal is to continue growing and strengthening herself and family, since everything that she does is for her daughters.  She wants her daughters, starting tomorrow, to be good people and useful to society.

She comes to Kiva and the foundation to ask for a loan in order to buy used clothing so that she can continue selling them, thereby having the income she needs to continue helping in her home and also helping her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol.  She has been engaged in the rice farming business together with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income. Maricel is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, they will be able to improve their farming business and augment their harvest and yield. In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 31-year-old farmer from Alicia, Bohol. She has been in the rice-farming business for more than ten years now. Her husband works with security personnel.

Myrna is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides, and other supplies.

In the future, Myrna hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her five children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Goerge

texts.en:
Goerge is 32 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Goerge has been working hard to manage his small shop, in which he sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Goerge has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes that will be sold. The loan will help Goerge to generate greater profits and pay for his children's school fees. Goerge hopes that, in the future, he will be able to build a very big, comfortable house for his family. 

Goerge is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Goerge who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eva Marie

texts.en: Eva Marie works hard to support her family. Eva Marie is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business. Eva Marie has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, Eva Marie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice for selling at profit

loans.name: Merry

texts.en: Merry is 36 years old and married with two children. Merry works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc. Merry has been in this business for three years. In the future, Merry would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Joselita

texts.en: Joselita is 41 years old and single. She lives in Oroquieta City. She earns a living by selling ice cream. She has been doing this business for 10 years and earns 10,045 Philippine pesos a month from this work. Joselita has applied for a loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy an additional ice cream cart. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional ice cream cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa of Biasong, Lopez Jaena supports her family's needs through a fish vending business. She’s a 48-year-old married woman with five kids, who tries her best to earn on her own. For 20 years, she has managed this business and earns about 7,400 PHP per month. For the time being, she’s in need of buying more fish to sell. She joined this year and thanks GDMPC microfinance for the loan of 15,000 PHP they provided to her. Jesusa desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 32 años, está casado con la Sra. Felicia. El fabrica y vende sillones, sillitas, mesitas y sillas de jardín, todas de karanda´y (una clase de madera). Tienen tres hijos en edad escolar. Don Juan sale a vender sus productos en una plaza además de entregar a otros vendedores y realizar también trabajos sobre pedido.
Actualmente ya pudo montar una pequeña despencita para que su esposa pueda generar un nuevo ingreso  a la familia. Ellos  necesitan de este crédito para compra de karanda´y pues recibieron un pedido de amoblamiento para una casa, y quieren cumplir con ese pedido. Su mayor anhelo es poder terminar de construir su modesta vivienda y brindar a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar y ser personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Juan, 32, is married to Felicia and has three school-aged children. He makes and sells armchairs, small chairs, tables and garden chairs, all made of Karanda`y, a type of wood. Juan goes out to sell his products in a plaza, as well as delivering them to other merchants and making goods to order.

Currently he was able to start a small store so that his wife can generate more income for the family. They need this loan to buy Karanda`y because they received an order for home furnishings and they want to complete the order. His biggest wish is to be able to finish building his modest home and to give his kids the possibility of studying and being respected in society.

loans.use: to buy Karanda`y [wax palm] wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Emprendedoras” se fijo  como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. Son 12 mujeres que se esfuerzan día  a día para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.
La Sra. Teresa, presidenta del grupo es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora. Comenta ella que se dedica a la elaboración de comidas y que estas son muy aceptadas por sus clientes. Hace todo tipo de comidas, como sándwich, empanadas, croquetas y demás, tiene muchos clientes ya que se hizo muy conocida pues tiene muy buena sazón.
Hoy teresa solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras y demás insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas y de esa forma seguir deleitando a sus clientes con sus ricas comidas.
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Entrepreneurial Women] is focused on the principal objective of the growth of each one of them.  They are renowned in their area as very hard working women.  They are 12 women that push themselves day to day in order to be able to help their children get ahead.  Teresa, the president of the group, is an entrepreneurial and innovative woman.  She comments that she earns a living making food and that it is well-liked by her customers.  She makes all types of food, such as sandwiches, empanadas, croquettes, and more.  She has a lot of customers because she has become very well-know as she has very good seasoning.  

Today Teresa requests this loan for the purchase of meat, condiments, vegetables and other supplies in order to continue making her food and in this way to continue delighting her customers with her delicious food.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Anim

texts.en:
Anim wants to take advantage of the forthcoming festive season of Christmas and the New Year, and so she is asking for a new loan to invest in her clothes-selling business. 

Anim wants to stock her business with a variety of clothing styles. She wants to buy more clothing for men, women, and children. 

Since her last loan, her income has gradually increased and she hopes that this loan will give her reasonable profits.

loans.use: to buy more men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a fish vendor from Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three young children. Her husband also works as a fish vendor.

Merlyn is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and buckets for storage. With this, she will be able sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income.

In the future, Merlyn dreams of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and buckets.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 42 years old and married with 2 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She lives in the Philippines.

Rosemarie has a business of buying and selling peanuts. She has requested a PHP19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional peanuts and other ingredients for her business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional peanuts and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 51 years old and a widow with 2 children.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of direct sales of Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like lotion, shampoo and perfumes, etc.

Susana has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business of direct sales of Avon products for 9 years.

Susana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like lotion, shampoo and perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Celita

texts.en:
This is Ma. Celita. She is 57 and married to Eugenio, a contractor. Ma. Celita is a mother to her children. They live in the Philippines. She and her husband manage their household while she also operates her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Ma. Celita operates a meat stall, buying meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are chicken and pork meat. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of chicken and pork meat needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Celita hopes that her business will grow and dreams that the time will come that she no longer has to borrow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and as a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for chicken and pork meat that she needs in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita earns a living through her convenience store. She sells various goods to the people in her place in Ubay, Bohol.

Nenita is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soda and beverages, snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soda and beverages, snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
A $ 1,000 loan is offered to Veronica to improve her business. Veronica opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working. She will use the loan to buy stocks of oil, sleepers, detergent, soap, and rice to keep in her store and re-sell. 

Veronica is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.  

Veronica is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, sleepers, detergent, soap, and rice to re-sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba, in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, James has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells items such as sugar, salt, and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to attract more customers, and will help James to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for his children. James hopes that in the future he will be able to have a fully stocked shop and that all the customers will buy from him. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to attract more customers to his shop.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is from Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is 43 years old and married with four children. Nenita makes a living through fish vending. She has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Nenita joined GDMP. Nenita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 37 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Caroline has been working hard to manage her pharmacy, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items such as Pampers, cotton wool, Panadol, and Septrin for patients, and will help Caroline to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Caroline hopes that in the future she will be able to start up another drugshop within town. 

Caroline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Caroline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items for her pharmacy such as pampers, cotton wool, Panadol, and Septrin for patients.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn, 33, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Loreto, a driver and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Analyn owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Analyn dreams of having another jeepney and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

Note: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is from Tuburan Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 40 years old. Olivia is married and has three children. To make a living, Olivia raises pigs for sale. Olivia has been in her business for 12 years and earns 3,200 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Olivia joined GDMPC. Olivia now is requesting  a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla of Tuburan, Villaflor, Oroguieta has been raising pigs for more than 5 years and earns 4,000 PHP per month. She is 56 years old now, yet continues to hang on to her piggery livelihood to give her 3 children an adequate life. In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she is borrowing an amount of 18,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feeding supplies. Perla became a member of GDMPC in 2008. Perla hopes that some day, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is married and a mother of five children. She used her previous loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell. Her business did very well and she successfully repaid her loan. Patricia has been in business for six years. She is very hard working and ambitious. Faulu Kenya has helped her learn how to save her money and she has expanded her business.
Patricia hopes to open a boutique. She requires a loan of 84,442.50 KES to increase her stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To increase her stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” se encuentra en el duodécimo ciclo del programa de Mujeres tiene 16 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción; todas las integrantes trabajan por sus hijos, ya que quieren darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de estas mujeres sacrificadas es Gladys, quien se dedica al reciclaje de todo tipo de productos, como ser plásticos, cartones, aluminio, metales y demás. Gladys recolecta todos estos materiales de cualquier lugar en forma ambulante, ella misma nos comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto y no tiene vergüenza de ello.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de plásticos y cartones, con lo cual podrá revender, y de esa forma tener mayores ingresos. Las integrantes agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo
texts.en:
The committee "Kuña Guapa" is in the twelfth cycle of the women's program. The group has 16 members, from the Asunción zone. All of the members work on behalf of their children because they want to give them all that they could not have.

One of these selfless women is Gladys, who works in recycling of all types of products, including plastics, cartons, aluminum, metals, and the rest. Gladys collects all of these materials, going from one place to the other. She herself commented that she is very proud of what she does because it is a respectable and honest job, and she does not have shame about it. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of plastics and cartons, which she will be able to resell, and in this way have increased income. The group members are grateful for the help that they are receiving.

loans.use: To buy plastics and cartons for resale.

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Ubay, Bohol.

Noli is engaged in the hog-raising business and is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise.
 
In the future, Noli hopes to make her business a success and to save money to continue to send her children to school for a better education.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce such as maize flour, beans and rice for resale, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits, improve on her business and add other different products. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a grinding machine that will be used to process the products. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce such as maize flour, beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
This is Marcela, 51, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Celso who works as a security guard and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Marcela operates a pineapple farm. She grows pineapple on their farm located in Cavite. It is in the highlands where it is suitable to grow pineapple. She sells her product to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business and part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marcela dreams of being able to give her children a good and quality education and hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is now 56 years old and has five children. She used her previous loan to buy beads and reeds for making baskets. Her business did very well and she repaid her loan. She has been in business for the last nine years.

She hopes to buy a piece of land, build her own house and open other outlets for selling curios. She requires a loan of 63,585 KES to buy beads and curios.

loans.use: to buy beads and curios

loans.name: Jairon Aurelio

texts.es:
Jairon Aurelio tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 8,5 y seis meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.

Jairon Aurelio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz,admàs se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas. Las compras las realizarà en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos y posterior venderlos a un buen precio.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrà ampliar la agricultura sembrando maìz. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son: la competencia, las plagas, enfermedades que se dan en los cultivos. El sueño es seguir prosperando gracias al trabajo.

En los tiempos libres le gusta viajar en moto y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Jairon Aurelio is 33 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children, ages 8, 5, and six months, in the Ventanas settlement of Los Rios.

The San Nicloas communal bank is located in Recinto San Nicolás, Puerto Pechiche parrish, part of the Puerto Viejo settlement.  The people here farm and raise short cycle corn.

Jairon Aurelio is a farmer and raises corn, rice, pigs and chickens.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and is asking for this loan to buy seeds and farming supplies such as urea, week killer, and fertilizer to keep his crops in good shape so that he can sell them at good prices.

This loan will be very helpful because he will be able to expand his farming by planting corn.  The challenges he faces include competition, crop disease, and blights.  His dream is to continue prospering, thanks to his work. 

He likes to travel by motorcycle and play sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Perlicita

texts.en:
Perlicita is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bohol, Philippines. Perlicita earns a living through her mat weaving business.

Perlicita is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for mat weaving such as romblon (a type of pine that grows by the beach) and dye or coloring.

In the future, Perlicita hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for mat weaving such as romblon and dye or coloring

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María, es una persona de alta admiración,  con valores cristianos inculcados por sus padres, la honradez, la humildad, el respeto el trabajo son cualidades que la definen muy bien, siendo un ejemplo de vida para sus 5 hijos, María tiene 61 años, y sigue trabajando con el mismo entusiasmo y alegría como cuando empezó hace muchos años atrás, son estas aptitudes y sentimientos de emprendimiento que han hecho de María un ejemplo para toda su comunidad.

María trabaja con Fodemi hace 12 años atrás y el crédito solicitado hoy a nuestra organización  es para la compra de mercadería como cobijas, sabanas, edredones y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños etc. Para la venta la venta en su local comercial ubicado en su casa.  María  trabaja gustosa sabiendo que cada día de trabajo puede ayudar en la economía de su hogar.

El sueño que Doña María tiene es comprarse un local en el centro de la ciudad de Ibarra y vender ahí su mercancía. María está segura que con trabajo y esfuerzo su sueño lo cumplirá ya que sus hijos la apoyan y le ayudan a que su sueño se haga realidad.
texts.en:
Maria is highly admired because of her Christian values instilled in her by her parents.  Honesty and respect for work, are qualities that define her well.  She is an example for her five children.  Maria is 61 years old and works with the same enthusiasm and joy as she had when she started many years ago.  It is these attitudes and entrepreneurial feelings that have made Maria an example for her entire community.

Maria has been working with Fodemi for 12 years and she is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as blankets, sheets, eiderdowns, and men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing, etc.  She sells from her home and works every day to be able to help her household finances.

Maria wants to buy herself a shop in the Ibarra city center so that she can sell merchandise from there.  She is certain that her work and effort will allow her to do this, especially because her children encourage and help her make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 51-year-old woman living in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has provided for the needs of her eight kids from the small sum of 8,000 PHP she has been earning monthly from her corn production business for 11 years. Her business is an aid to the income her husband earns from farming. In 2008, Irene joined GDMPC and she is applying for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité OÑONDIVEPA, hace más de un ano que está dentro del programa de la fundación, son mujeres muy activas, que trabajan arduamente y se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder ir mejorando el estilo de vida de sus familias.
Una gran mujer es la Sra. Carla, quien hace artesanías en Zapatillas, es una persona con gran talento, ya que borda todo tipo de cosas por las zapatillas, siempre tiene alguna novedad, lo cual gusta mucho a sus clientas. Es una persona con gran talento, y es por eso que no le cuesta mucho hacerse de mucha clientela. Ella quiere seguir trabajando, ya que así es como da a su familia lo que necesitan y también ella se siente útil.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra  de zapatillas, hilos, lentejuelas, pinzas y agujas para seguir bordando sus zapatillas.
texts.en:
The “OÑONDIVEPA” committee has been in the foundation’s program for more than one year.  These are active women who work arduously and help one another to improve their families’ lives.

Carla is a grand woman who does art on slippers.  She has a great talent and embroiders all things for slippers.  She also has a new idea that her customers like very much.  This is the reason it isn’t difficult for her to attract new customers.  She wants to keep working because this is how she provides for her family and she feels useful.

She is asking for this loan to buy slippers, thread, sequins, pliers, and needles to continue embroidering slippers.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Marydel

texts.en: Marydel is a 53-year-old widow with a child living in Maningcol, Ozamis City. In order to support her family, she entered into a buy and sell of RTWs (ready to wear items) business eight years ago. She usually gets 10,000 PHP per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Marydel is able to buy more RTW products to sell because of the money amounting to 50,000 PHP rendered to her. She joined GDMPC this 2012. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more RTW clothing to sell

loans.name: Lis

texts.es:
La señora Lis, es de la Ciudad de Santaní,  es soltera,  la señora se dedica a la venta de productos de todo tipo, ya que tiene una mercería bien surtida. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y muy humilde, cada dia lucha para poder salir adelante según comento empezó a trabajar como secretaria en una cabina telefónica, después en una casa comercial como vendedora de salón, desde ahí se enfoco hacia el negocio y soñó con tener su propio negocio para no depender de otro y ser independiente. Con su esfuerzo y dedicación trabajando duro y con la ayuda de sus familiares consiguió la que siempre soñaba de tener su propio negocio para poder tener una estabilidad laboral una calidad de vida mejor y la de su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas, artículos para el hogar, calzados y demás para poder seguir vendiendo y creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lis is from the city of Santaní, is single and sells all kinds of products, as she has a well stocked corner shop. She is hard-working, responsible and very modest. She struggles everyday to make ends. 

According to what she said, she began working as a secretary in a phone booth. Later, she worked in a commercial firm as a saleswoman. From there, she focused on businesses and dreamt on having her own business to not depend on others and to be independent. 

With her effort and dedication working hard, and with the help of her family, she got what she had always dreamt. She has her own business in order to have job security and a better quality of life for her and her family. 

She is requesting this loan to buy clothes, home ware, footwear and others to continue selling and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, home ware, footwear and others.

loans.name: Asmahou

texts.fr:
Madame Asmahou est née en Novembre 1985 à Sikasso, mariée et mère d’un garçon, elle vit avec son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Madame Asmahou est tailleur de formation, à défaut de pratiquer cette profession elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente des  fruits (mangues, oranges,  bananes, ananas, etc.) depuis quelques années. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de  Sikasso et de façon ambulante. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y'a environ deux années. Après deux prêts individuels bien remboursés, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 100 paniers de bananes(à raison de 2.500FCFA le panier actuellement)pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 F CFA qui sera utilisé augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Madam Asmahou was born in November 1985 in Sikasso. Married and mother to one boy, she lives with her husband in a large extended traditional family in Bougoula-Ville, the downtown of Sikasso.

Madam Asmahou is a tailor by training. In the absence of working in this profession she started in business buying and selling fruit (mangoes, oranges, bananas, pineapple, etc.) several years ago. She manages her business at the large market of Sikasso and as an itinerant saleswoman. Concerned with better satisfying her clientèle which is growing more and more, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago. After two individual loans which were well reimbursed, she is requesting this third loan with the goal of increasing her business in order to buy 100 baskets of bananas (at currently 2,500 FCFA per basket) to better satisfy her clientèle which is growing more and more.

With this loan she envisions making a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which will be used to increase her business, contribute to the family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou est une jeune célibataire sans enfant qui s’active dans l’aviculture depuis 5 ans maintenant. Elle est à son deuxième crédit à l’IMCEC et désire 100000F CFA pour acheter des poussins, les élever  pour les  revendre. Elle possède un poulailler qu’elle gère elle-même ; elle a le temps et l’amour du métier. Elle vit avec ses parents et avec les bénéfices, elle aide sa mère pour les dépenses de la famille. Avec le crédit reçu elle a pu diversifier les produits et services. Elle aimerait devenir une grande commerçante et ouvrir une cantine de vente de tissus.
texts.en:
Astou is a young, single woman with no children who has been participating in poultry farming for five years now. She is on her second IMCEC loan and would like 100,000CFA francs to purchase chicks and raise them to resell them. She owns a henhouse that she manages herself; she has the time to do it and loves her work.

Astou lives with her parents and, with the profits, she helps her mother with the family expenses. With the loan received she has been able to diversify her goods and services. Astou would like to become a major shopkeeper and open a market shop to sell fabrics.

loans.use: To purchase chicks to raise and resell.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 32 years old, and she is married to a chef. She has three children; her oldest is 13, and her youngest is 8. She’s been in business for two years, and she sells bed sheets. With the loan, she wants to buy more bedsheets for sale. Her profit would be put into renovating her house.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets for sale.

loans.name: Lolonyo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bijoux, Lolonyo est une jeune femme âgée de 29 ans.  Elle est mère d’un enfant de 03 ans non scolarisé. Elle a démarré son activité depuis déjà 06 ans et dispose d’un étalage au marché. Elle sollicite son second prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter des bijoux supplémentaires afin de renforcer son commerce. Elle désire ouvrir sa boutique privée et assurer l’autosuffisance  alimentaire de sa  famille.
texts.en: Lolonyo is a young woman of 29 whose business is re-selling jewelry.  She is the mother of a 3-year-old child who does not attend school.  Lolonyo set up her business six years ago and has a stall at the market.  She is requesting her second loan from WAGES to buy additional jewelry to strengthen her business.  She would like to open her own private store and ensure food security for her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает  4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Роза с 1990 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Розы имеется 2 коровы, 1 телок,15 овец, 8 коз и 2 лошади. Перепродажа скота и разведение скота приносит 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства за счет покупку скота. В планах у розы женить старшего сына.
texts.en:
Roza is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  Her family's main source of income has been Roza's animal husbandry business, which she began in 1990 with 15,000 som (KGS).  Today, she has two cows, one calf, 15 sheep, eight goats, and two horses.  Raising and selling cattle bring in 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Roza applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) to buy three bulls.  Roza plans to invest the profits from the loan in the further expansion of her business by buying more cattle.  Among Roza's plans is to marry off her eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bulls

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwavita  est présidente du groupe Tosheka. Mariée à un homme d’affaire. Elle est âgée de 41 ans et mère de 9 enfants, tous  scolarisés. La cliente est vendeuse de farines et autres denrées alimentaires. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 3 sacs de farines de 50kgs à marchander .  Elle souhaite voir son entreprise grandir et  scolariser correctement ses enfants. Ainsi, elle  remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes.
texts.en: Mwavita is the president of the Tosheka group. Married to a businessman, she is 41 years old and the mother of nine children, all in school. She sells flour and other food products. The loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase three 50 kg sacks of flour to resell. She hopes to see her business grow in the future and to make sure her children get proper schooling. She thanks Hekima and partners for their actions to help poor women.

loans.use: to purchase three 50kg sacks of flour.

loans.name: Serge Paulin

texts.fr: Serge est un jeune camerounais de 32 ans, célibataire, sans enfant. Il mène une activité de production et vente des beignets dans coin de la ville depuis 1 an déjà. il voudrait accroître ses ventes pour satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle et constituer de ce fait un portefeuille clientèle considérable. Il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 03 pousse-pousse, 3 glacières et 3 casse à beignets pour pouvoir écouler sa production qu'il compte tripler. les bénéfices supplémentaires lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Serge is a young man from Cameroun; 32 years old, single, without children. He started a business making and selling doughnuts in a corner of town a year ago. He would like to grow his sales to meet his customers' demand, thus building a large customer base. With the proceeds of this loan, he would like to purchase three trolleys, three ice boxes and three doughnut fryers in order to handle his production, which he hopes to multiply by three.
The extra profits will allow him to more easily cover the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул 50 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Рыскул занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 1984 году с 10,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Рыскул, ее поголовье насчитывает 8 коров, 5 коз, 2 лошади и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Рыскул планирует вложить в реконструкцию дома, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Ryskul is 50 years old, married, and has four children.  Ryskul is in the business of raising livestock, which is her family's main source of income.  She started her business in 1984 with 10,000 som (KGS) and today it brings in about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  As a result of Ryskul's hard work, she now has eight cows, five goats, two horses, and ten sheep.

With an aim to further developing her business, Ryskul has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  Ryskul plans to invest the profits in rebuilding her home, and, later, in increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, fait de la vente de tissus et divers autres produits. Elle a une expérience de 20 ans dans ce domaine. Elle commence sa journée à 7h et la fini à 13h. Avec le crédit reçu, elle veut acheter des tissus, du savon, du karité. Elle pourra élargir le nombre de ses employés car  il y a ses enfants qui lui placent dès fois la marchandise. Madame Aminata aide son mari dans les charges familiales. Avec le fond nécessaire, elle rêve de devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en: Madame Aminata is married and mother to 3 children. She is a trader of fabric and various other products. She has 20 years experience in this field. She starts her day at 7am and finishes at 1pm. She will use this loan to buy fabric, soap and shea butter. She will be able to increase the number of her employees because her children have been, at times, selling the goods. Madame Aminata helps her husband with the family expenses. With sufficient funding, she dreams of one day becoming a great trader.

loans.use: to buy fabric, soap and shea butter for resale

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат проживает в районе Спитамен. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает шафером. Сама Саодат зарабатывает путем разведения мелко - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается у себя дома. Саодат берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота. Она имеет богатый опыт в этой области.
texts.en:
Saodat lives in the Spitamen region.  She is 45 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband works as a driver.  Saodat, however, earns money by raising sheep.  Hers is a home-based business.  

Saodat is taking out this loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd.  She has a great deal of experience in this field.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом житель Спитаменского района. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Жена Абдусалома занимается торговлей обуви на рынке. Его дети маленькие. Абдусалом занимается животноводством. У него дома имеются условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота. Абдусалом пятнадцать лет как занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он бреет кредит для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en: Abdusalom is a resident of the Spitamen region.  He is 53 years old, married, and has two children.  They are still small.  Abdusalom's wife sells shoes at the market.  Abdusalom raises cattle for resale.  His home has facilities for raising large cattle and he has been in this business for 15 years.  He is taking out this loan to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 47 лет, замужем. Бактыгул имеет среднее образование по специальности секретарь референт.  С 1996 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 2,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка и 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 8,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины и построить дом сыну.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 47 years old and married.  She has a secondary-level education as an administrative assistant.  She has a business in raising cattle, which she began in 1996 with 2,000 som (KGS).  As a result of her hard work, Baktygul now has 2 milk cows, 2 bulls, and 2 horses.  The monthly income from her business comes to 8,000 som.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Baktygul has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle for fattening up and selling.  Baktygul is planning to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the number of domestic cattle she has, and to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунире 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, так как на родине он не имел постоянную работу. После того как ее муж уехал, Мунира стала основной кормилицей   в семье. Она несколько лет назад обучилась в курсе шитья и кройки и имеет опыта в шитье женской одежды.  Ее навыки и опыт дали ей шанс стать тренером в курсе шитья и кройки и таким образом зарабатывать на жизнь. Уже 3 месяца она занимается этим делом и хочет организовать свой бизнес. Она хочет открыть собственный швейный цех, где она будет обслуживать клиентов, а также обучать несколько учеников. Для открытия швейного цеха, она нуждается швейной машинки, но не имеет средства для этого. Ее муж отказался ей отправить деньги для покупки швейной машинки и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется только на вас. Это займ поможет ей организовать свой бизнес и таким путем найти источник дохода, который принесет в ее дом стабильность.
texts.en:
Munira is 40 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband moved to the Russian Federation because he didn't have steady employment in his motherland.  Since her husband left, Munira has been the primary breadwinner for the family.  Several years ago, she studied in a dressmaking course and she has experience in sewing women's clothing.  Her work habits and experience gave her an opportunity to earn money by teaching a dressmaking course.  She has been doing this for three months already and she wants to open her own sewing shop where she will both serve customers and teach several students.

Munira needs a sewing machine in order to open her shop, but she doesn't have the financial resources to buy one.  Her husband refused to send her the money, so she is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine.  She anticipates your kindness and she is relying only on you.  This loan will help her to open her own business, giving her a source of income that will bring stability into her home.

loans.use: to buy sewing a machine

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa vit avec son conjoint mécanicien et leur 04enfants à Lomé. Trois vont à l’école. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle a commencé par vendre des produits d’alimentation générale à domicile. Activité qu’elle exerce depuis 2003.  Elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des sacs de riz, des cartons de tomates, des bidons d’huile végétale et autres produits pour vendre afin de tirer plus de profit.  Avec les profits supplémentaires, elle voudrait construire sa maison pour louer, élargir sa boutique afin de devenir grossiste et améliorer les conditions de  vie de la famille. Elle est âgée de 26ans.
texts.en:
Akossiwa lives in Lomé with her four children and her husband, a mechanic.  Three of the couple's children attend school.  In order to help her husband to provide for the family, she started selling general food products from home in 2003.

She is taking a first loan from WAGES to buy bags of rice, boxes of tomatoes, cans of vegetable oil, and other products that she will resell to make more profits.

With her additional profits, she would like to build a house to be rented out, to expand her shop in order to become a wholesaler, and to improve her family's living conditions.  Akossiwa is 26 years old.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат 26 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей, младшему из которых 4 года. Саламат имеет высшее образование После окончания школы клиентка поступила в Аграрный Институт по специальности "Экономист-менеджер" - с 2006 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Саламат имеется 2 лошади, 1 корова. доходы от перепродажи скота и продажи молока составляют примерно 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Саламат обрабатывает 0,3 га  земли где ежегодно сажают Фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Саламат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на закуп  1 коровы и скота. Доходы от кредита Саламат планирует вкладывать в увеличения поголовья скота и увеличение площади посевных полей.
texts.en:
Salamat is 26 years old, married, and raising 2 children, the youngest of whom is 4 years of age. Salamat has post-secondary education: after graduating from high school, she enrolled in the Agrarian Institute to study economics and management. Since 2006, Salamat has been raising livestock and cultivating crops, having started her business with an initial investment of 20,000 som (KGS). Presently, she keeps 2 horses and 1 cow. Her income from resale of livestock and sales of milk amounts to roughly 5,000 som (KGS) per month. Salamat also works 0.3 hectares of land where she annually plants beans.

In order to continue developing her business, Salamat has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase 1 cow and other livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further increasing the size of her herd, as well as expanding the area of the land she cultivates.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат молодая и энергичная женщина, которая живет далеко от столицы Таджикистана, но всегда старается не отставать от современного развивающегося мира. Она замужем на хорошего человека, которого зовут Ассадулло. Она еще не имеет детей и мечтает, чтобы у нее родились хорошие дети. Она живет с мужем и родителями мужа. Родители мужа пенсионеры, а муж получает маленькую зарплату.  Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Саломат решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания, а также создать свой материнский капитал для будущих детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Salomat is an energetic young woman who lives far from Tajikistan's capital city but nevertheless tries to keep up with the modern world. She is married to a good man by the name of Assadullo. They do not yet have children, but dream of having beautiful babies. Salomat and her husband live together with his parents. Assadullo's parents are pensioners, while he earns only a small salary, which is insufficient to provide the family with all necessities of life. Salomat has decided to help her husband for the good of the family, and to this end took the course "Succeed" organized by the Association of Business Women and earned her graduation certificate. Now she is quite ready to launch her own business and achieve success.

Salomat would like to start her business of buying and selling cattle, as she has experience in this line of work. She plans to use her profits to improve her living conditions, as well as accumulate savings for her future children. Salomat is requesting a loan of 2500 somoni to purchase livestock and launch her new business. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock for launching her new business

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 52 года, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. Гульмира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день  хозяйство Гульмиры очень развитое и и имеет хороший потенциал. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку  молодых овец и телят для откорма и последующей реализации. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 52 years old, married, and has raised 3 children. As the main source of income for her family, Gulmira has been raising livestock since 2000, having started her business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Her business has developed very well so far and has good potential for future growth.

In order to continue developing her business, Gulmira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase young sheep and calves for fattening and subsequent resale. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves and young sheep

loans.name: Abdullobeg

texts.ru: Абдуллобег, когда в детстве играл с друзьями, всегда входил в роль преподавателя. Когда он вырос, его детская мечта осуществилась в реальность, и он стал учителем истории и права. Ему 55 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Его жена пенсионерка и получает маленькую пенсию, что не хватает даже для обеспечения ее самой. Дети совершеннолетние и помогают ему для обеспечения семьи. Они используют свои доходы вместе для покупки продукты питания, одежды, а также для образования. Абдуллобег работает в средней школе и очень любит свою профессию. Его зарплата не хватает, чтобы сделать сбережения. Скоро одна из его дочерей выходит замуж. Он должен купить приданное, а также проводить свадебное мероприятие, которое по  таджикскому обычаю называется «домодталабон». Это мероприятие проводится в доме или в ресторане участием родных и друзей. Накрывается шикарный стол и участвует певец. Это очень интересное мероприятие, где невесту украшают национальными украшениями. Абдуллобег запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Он ждет вашу доброту. Это займ поможет ему сделать счастливой его дочь. Он как добросовестный человек обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
When Abdullobeg was a child and played with his friends, he always wanted to play the role of the teacher.  When he grew up, his childhood dream came true.  He is a teacher of history and law.  He is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  His wife is retired and receives a small pension that isn't enough to pay for even her own needs.  The children are adults and help him provide for their family.  They put their money together and use it to buy food, clothing, and to pay for education.  Abdullobeg works in a high school and he loves his profession, but his salary isn't large enough for him to put any money into savings.

Soon, one of his daughters is going to get married.  Abdullobeg has to pay the dowry and throw a wedding party, which in the Tajik tradition is called a "domodtalabon."  This is a party that is held at home or in a restaurant with friends and family participating.  The table is lavishly set and there is a singer.  At this interesting ceremony, the bride gets bedecked with traditional adornments.  

Abdullobeg is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS) to hold the wedding party.  He is relying on your kindness.  This loan will help him make his daughter happy.  As the conscientious man he is, he promises to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party of his daughter

loans.name: Murotjon

texts.ru: Дом, где живет  Муротджон, не отвечает стандартам жилья и он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Ему 42  лет, он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети совершеннолетние и помогают ему в ведении бизнеса.  У Муротджона есть стоительная бригада, и он более чем 17 лет занимается обслуживанием ремонта дома. Его жена работает медсестрой в клинике и получает маленькую зарплату. Муротджон должен отремонтировать дом, то есть заменить окна и двери, так как зимой они не держат теплоту дома внутри, а в Таджикистане зима довольно холодная. Муротджон запрашивает займ на сумму  2000 сомони для покупки окон для ремонта дома. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется только на вас.
texts.en:
Murotjon's house is in very poor condition and he must repair it quickly. He is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children in his care. The children are of the age of majority and help their father with his business. Murotjon has a construction crew, and for over 17 years he has been servicing and repairing people's homes. His wife works as a nurse in a clinic and earns a small salary.

Murotjon needs to repair his home and replace old doors and windows that do not currently provide good insulation against Tajikistan's cold winter. He is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to purchase new windows for his house. Murotjon is counting on your kindness as he has nowhere else to turn.

loans.use: to buy windows for repairing his house

loans.name: Idris

texts.ru: Идрис проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 62 года. Он разведен. Идрис три года проработал юристом. У него высшее юридическое образование. На сегодняшний день Идрис предоставляет услугу. Он работает по маршруту №3 по центральной дороге города. Идрис берет кредит для ремонта автомобиля и дома.
texts.en: Idris lives in Dushanbe.  He is 62 years old and divorced.  Idris has a higher education in law and he worked for three years as an attorney.   Today he offers taxi services, working route No. 3 along the city's main road.  Idris is taking out the loan to repair his car and his home.

loans.use: to repair his car and house

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. С детства он работал и трудился для благо получения семьи, так как они жили бедно в трудных условиях. В то время как его одноклассники играли во дворе после школы, Хусейн работал в кафе, пекарни разнорабочим. Когда он немного вырос, он научился ремонту дома у одного мастера, и стал работать как мастер по ремонту дома. Однако расход семьи увеличивалось, и он был вынужден уехать в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы найти подходящею работу. Данное время ему 34 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 прекрасных детей. Его жена немного подрабатывает купле продажей детской одежды. Он сам работает в пекарни в своей родине, так как ему не удалось в миграции найти подходящею работу. Дети еще не трудоспособные и учатся в средней школе. Хусейн очень заботливый отец и тратит все свои деньги на их содержания. Хусейн имеет машину, в котором его семья очень нуждается. Его машина недавно сломалась, а у Хусейна нет денег для ремонта машины. Еще он должен сделать мелкий ремонт часть дома и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для ремонта машины и дома. Он является повторным клиентом и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Huseyn is a very hard-working and purposeful person. Since childhood, he has laboured for his family's well-being, as they lived in difficult conditions. While his classmates played outside after school, Huseyn worked as an assistant in a cafe-bakery. When he grew a little older, he learned home repair from a professional and began working as a repairman himself. However, the family's expenses grew, and Huseyn was forced to travel to Russia to find work. 

Currently, Huseyn is 34 years old, married, and has 3 wonderful children in his care. Huseyn's wife is engaged part-time in selling children's clothing, while he works in a bakery after being unable to find good work abroad. The children are too young to work and currently attend school. Huseyn is a very caring father and spends all his money on his children's well-being.

Huseyn owns a car, which is an absolute necessity for his family. The car recently began to malfunction, but Huseyn lacks the money for its repairs. Additionally, he needs to carry out small repairs in his home. Therefore, Huseyn is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to repair his car and his house. He is a return client of IMON International and has a good credit history. He needs and counts on your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car and his house

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзаде 34 годa, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывает троих детей, младшему из которых два годика. После окончания университета, Айзада  2000 году, в поисках  источника финансирования для своей семьи, Айзада начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 1  корова с теленком, 5 голов овец. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Айзада обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец молодняк. Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство. Ведь в будущем ей предстоит налаживать жизнь детей, она думает сейчас начать чтобы потом было легче.
texts.en:
Aizada is 34 years old and married.  She and her husband have three children, the youngest of whom is just two years old.  After graduating from the university in 2000, Aizada began working in animal husbandry to give her family a source of income.   She started her business with 6,000 som (KGS) and it now brings in about 4,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products and cattle.   Today, she has one cow and its calf and five sheep.  

With an aim to increasing the number of cattle she has, she applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and young sheep.  Aizada plans to invest the profits from the loan in increasing the size of her herd, which will expand her business.  After all, one day she will have to get her children established in life and she wants to get started now so it will be easier later.

loans.use: to purchase calves and young sheep

loans.name: Abdulmanon

texts.ru: Абдулманон житель района Рудаки. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Абдулманон предоставляет услугу. Он занимается ремонтом автомашин. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Абдулманон берет кредит для приобретения инструментов.
texts.en: Abdulmanon lives in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. Abdulmanon's wife takes care of the household while he works as a car mechanic. He has been in this line of work for four years. Abdulmanon is requesting this loan to purchase tools.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Jamalkan

texts.ru: Жамалкан 62 года, замужем, воспитала пятерых детей. Жамалкан 30 лет назад начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Начатое с суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и перепродажи скота.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Жамалкан обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и  и молодых овец. Доходы от кредита Жамалкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашние скотины, и в ближайшем будущем – улучшить содержание скота.
texts.en: Jamalkan is 62 years old, married, and has raised five children. She started her livestock business 30 years ago with a sum of 1,000 som (KGS). Today, she earns around 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy products and resale of livestock. In order to further increase the size of her herd, Jamalkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves and young sheep. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd, and also intends to improve the animal's living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase calves and young sheep

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru: Умарали проживает в районе Рудаки. Он женатый молодой человек. У него один ребенок. Жена Умарали домохозяйка. Умарали имеет среднее образование.
