texts.en: Felix is grateful for UGAFODE because it has taken him so far. It was from this institution that his father, a longtime client, borrowed the money to pay Felix's university tuition. Felix now has a job and is reciprocating by paying tuition for his siblings. He is also building a house where he will live with his elderly father since he lost his mother years ago. Some of his siblings will also live in the house to reduce the cost of living in the city. He is a hardworking young man who is grateful for UGAFODE for partnering with his father to educate him and his sibling and for helping him to build a home.

loans.use: To buy cement, doors, and windows to complete his house

loans.name: Zarife

texts.en:
Zarife lives in a southwestern part of Kosovo in a minority community. She is a housewife and stay-at-home mother. Her husband works in a warehouse with a very low salary; he is the main source of income for his family. Together, they have a 2-year-old child. 

The family is living in unacceptable living conditions. They live in a small house, and during the rainy season and wintertime, they have a serious problem with the insulation from the windows and doors. 

Zarife is requesting a loan to buy windows and door frames to improve the living conditions and the family's overall health during the cold and rainy seasons. Zarife is very grateful to Kiva lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To buy windows and door frames.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 45-year-old business lady and a mother of three children. She rears rabbits for resale and does mixed farming as well. She is very hardworking lady and very focused as she also uses part of the income from her businesses to support widows and orphans within her area. 

Catherine is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD. after being introduced by an existing customer. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm in preparation for the planting season. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will improve and expand her farming activities. 

In the future, she hopes to export her farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Maya Trust Group

texts.en:
Immaculate is a 56-year-old woman, who works as a poultry farmer in Maya Trust Group's village.  She started this business to raise money to pay for school fees for her children. She has 16 children, and 2 of them are still in school.  Her main business challenges include competition from other farmers, and affording expensive chicken feed. 

Immaculate would like to grow her business.  She wants to generate more income to support her grandchildren, in particular to afford their school fees. She is a hard working woman, which is how she has been able to raise as many as 16 children. Through the loan group she has learnt about modern farming methods, as well as good sanitation and nutrition for her children. 

Immaculate is grateful to Ugafode for partnering with her group to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Onix De Jesus

texts.es: Onix de 50 años, habita con su hija de 26 años en uno de los barrios mas tradicionales de la ciudad de Barranquilla, su temperamento alegre y cordial, la hacen merecedora de una gran popularidad en el barrio y ella la aprovecha para fortalecer sus negocios mediante los cuales se dedica a la preparación de almuerzo y comidas, además y de vender cervezas y gaseosas en un punto frio,  que es muy concurrido. Su primera iniciativa comercial data de hace 8 años, cuando trabajó en un restaurante del centro de la ciudad y su propietaria se enfermó,  debiendo cerrarlo. Esto    generó  a Onix, la necesidad de trabajar independientemente y estar mas cerca del cuidado de su hija, así fue como en su propia casa, empezó vendiendo almuerzos y poco a poco hizo crecer su negocio, aportándole su mayor dinamismo y disciplina de trabajo. Cuando inició lo hizo en la época de carnaval y esto fue una oportunidad para medir sus ventas y estimular sus deseos de hacerlo crecer y sacar adelante a su hija, como lo logró pues estudia enfermería y muy pronto la terminará. En la actualidad sus ventas se han incrementado y su demanda crece cada vez mas, por eso tener un capital de trabajo, para invertir y satisfacer a su clientela, se convierte en todo un desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un cedikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, hará mejoramiento del local, para tener un espacio mejor organizado, que despierte a su clientela, el deseo de regresar a su negocio a consumir los productos que ofrece. Su mayor sueño de prosperidad es lograr que su hija termine su carrera profesional y que tenga un futuro lleno de muchos éxitos.
texts.en:
Onix is 50 and lives with her 26-year-old daughter is one of the most traditional areas of Barranquilla, a pleasant and welcoming city. She is very popular in her neighborhood, and she takes advantage of this to grow her business selling prepared foods and cold beer and sodas. She started her business eight years ago when the owner of the restaurant where she worked became ill and closed the business. Onix, therefore, had to work on her own and needed to care for her daughter. She began to sell lunches from her house and slowly grew the business by putting her energy and effort behind it. 

She began the business during carnival season, which gave her a chance to gauge sales and instilled in her the desire to grow it to support her daughter, who will soon finish her nursing courses. Her sales and demand continue to grow, and having capital to invest and satisfy her customers is a challenge. This is why she approached Kiva for a loan, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy commodities and renovate and reorganize her space. She hopes this will inspire customers to come back to enjoy the food she serves. Her great dream is that her daughter finishes her studies and enjoys a successful future.

loans.use: to buy commodities and renovate her space.

loans.name: Valerie Aimee

texts.en:
Valerie is a Middle Cameroonian operating a small restaurant in a semi-urban area. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Her oldest child is 12 years old and in primary school, and the youngest is 4 months old.

This loan will enable Valerie to buy raw food items like bunches of plantains, bags of rice, tomatoes, cassava, etc. to increase her daily output. This will go a long toward increasing her standard of living.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye est chauffeur  depuis 5 ans. Il possède un parc automobile très vaste. Il vient solliciter un crédit de 350000F CFA pour pouvoir acheter un moteur et réfectionner son véhicule. Il est marié et père de famille. Il gère les besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Grace au crédit et aux bénéfices réalisés, il peut désormais mettre de l’argent de coté et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Abdoulaye travaille pour toujours augmenter son parc automobile.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye has been working as a driver for 5 years.  He owns a large fleet of vehicles.  He has requested a loan for 350,000 francs to buy an engine and refurbish his vehicle.

Abdoulaye is married and has children.  He provides for his family's daily needs.  Thanks to the loan and the profits from it, he can put some money to one side from now on and improve his family's nutrition.

Abdoulaye is always working to increase the size of his fleet.

loans.use: to buy an engine to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 35-year-old man living in the town of Mbarara, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is single, with two children, one of whom is currently in school.  For three years, Nelson has worked hard at running his general store, which sells sugar, salt, apples and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Nelson has asked for a loan of 2, 000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He is planning to use his loan to buy more essential commodities such as milk, apples, cooking oil, sugar, and salt.  This will attract more customers which will help Nelson to generate greater profits, to pay for school fees and the other basic needs of his family. Nelson hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a supermarket. 

Nelson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nelson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, apples, cooking oil, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a Cameroonian, 39 years old, living in a rural center and operating a small provision store. He is married and a father of three. His first child is in primary school and his wife is nursing the other two at home. 

This loan will help Jacob to stock his store with provisions like soap, sugar, salt, chocolates, soft drinks, beer, magi (bullion) cubes, etc. It will equally increase his living standard and that of his household.

loans.use: to buy provisions for his store.

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en: Fauzia describes herself as a God-fearing, honest, and faithful woman who is also a mother of a four-year-old son. She has been running a business where she provides printing and photocopying services. Fauzia has had this business for two years. Thanks to it, it has helped her provide good education to her son, who is currently in kindergarten. She needs to buy printing papers, toner and other photocopying equipment and materials so that her business can remain stable. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy printing papers, toner and other photocopying equipment and materials

loans.name: Pamellah

texts.en:
Pamellah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of them are currently in school. For the past 6 years, Pamellah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, apples and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Pamellah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase essential commodities such as milk, apples, cooking oil, sugar and salt to attract more customers, and will help Pamellah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Pamellah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another wholesale business. 

Pamellah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Pamellah, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase essential commodities such as milk, apples, cooking oil, sugar and salt to attract more customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics for a beauty salon business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer to cultivate maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Francois Miterrand

texts.en: Mitterrand is a young Cameroon man, age 28, living in a semi-urban area and runs a small plank and wood production business. He has been in this business for over a year now. He is married with a child. This loan will help him buy 20 small tress from rural areas for the production of 75 planks and five tons of firewood for resale. It will equally increase the living standard of his family.

loans.use: buy small trees for the production of planks and wood

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 50-year-old woman, married to a businessman called Silas. They are blessed with four children. Jacinta has been selling second-hand clothes for the past 10 years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET by an another borrower. She will use the loan to purchase more stocks of second hand clothes, in preparation for the higher demand over the festive season. She plans to educate her children with the income earned from the business.

Jacinta dreams of being able to buy second hand clothes in bulk for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 39-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya. He lives with his wife and two children, both of whom are in school. 

Stephen has been in farming for the past fifteen years, producing milk, poultry products, and maize, which he sells to the people in his local area. He is employed as a lab technician as an additional source of income.

Stephen is requesting a 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This will increase Stephen's dairy produce and earn him extra income from selling the milk, which will help him boost his living standards and help pay for his children's education. 

Stephen aspires to be a large-scale farmer in the next five years. Lack of enough animal feed, as well as pests and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr:
Madame Dior une femme de plus de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants est une commerçante qui exerce depuis 10 ans. Elle fait de la transformation de céréales locales. Elle achète du mil qu’elle transforme en couscous et qu’elle revend chez elle. Elle possède une clientèle solide et régulière qui fait la commande quotidiennement. Elle gagne un bénéfice de 3000F CFA sur une dépense de 7000F CFA par jour. Elle commence sa journée à 17h l’après-midi pour terminer à 00h.
Avec les bénéfices, elle réussi à payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, d’épargner un peu d’argent pour pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle désire devenir une grande commerçante un jour.
texts.en:
Madam Dior is more than 50 years old, married and mother to 5 children, and has been a shopkeeper for 10 years. She processes local cereals. She buys mil [African cereal] which she processes into couscous and resells from home. She has a solid and regular clientele that orders daily. She makes a profit of 3,000 FCFA on 7,000 FCFA of spending per day. She begins her day at 5pm and finishes at midnight. 

With the profits, she succeeds in paying the school fees of her children and saving a little money to be able to improve the nutrition of her family. She wants to become a great shopkeeper one day.

loans.use: to buy mil [African cereal] to process it into couscous and resell it.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 35 years old, married and lives with her husband and five minor children.

Several times, she has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Ekaterine’s husband, who works as an artisan.

Ekaterine requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to their low income.

With the loan proceeds, Ekaterine would like to purchase clothes at wholesale prices so that she can re-sell them in her district for a profit. It will be hard work for Ekaterine, but she expects to use the loan proceeds to make her business more profitable and to increase the income of her family. The increase in profits will be reinvested in her clothing trading business so that she can increase her inventory and sales volume. As a result, she believes that her her family will have more funds to satisfy their living expenses and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothing for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Euphasie

texts.en:
Euphasie is 40 years old and married with four children. She is a Cameroonian and she lives in an urban area. Euphasie's oldest child is in college and her youngest is in primary school. For the past two years, she has run a boutique and she has gained a lot of experience and customers. 

Euphasie is requesting a loan to purchase ready-made women's shoes, handbags, necklaces, and bracelets. She will use the profit from her loan to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase ready-made women's shoes, handbags, necklaces, and bracelets

loans.name: Lovias

texts.en:
Lovias is 27 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Lovias has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Lovias has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to purchase more essential commodities for her store, such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt, in order to attract more customers. This will help Lovias to generate greater profits and take good care of herself. Lovias hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a big supermarket in town. 

Lovias is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lovias who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to attract more customers.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso, de 41 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador con muchas ganas de sobresalir, es soltero e independiente, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de sus 04 amigos compartiendo los gastos mutuamente.
La actividad que realiza Celso es la agricultura para eso se  ha asociado con su padre quien tiene un terreno donde cultivan semilla de verduras y hortalizas,  y que luego son vendidas en el mercado de su localidad, con el dinero obtenido puede  cubrir pagos de  sus necesidades básicas. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 07 años.
Le gusta su actividad pues comparte con su padre un negocio familiar, además siente que los apoya y logra generarse un ingreso económico para pagarse sus gastos personales, comenta que no le agrada cuando alguna plaga quiere malograr sus cosechas pero los combate  a tiempo, para ello cuenta con obreros que contrata para cuidar sus sombríos. Con las ganancias que le deja tiene planes de abrir un restaurante en la ciudad ya que conoce  de cocina.
Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, se siente contento y agradecido por el apoyo financiero para continuar con su negocio, además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes que en mayoría son sus vecinos y los considera ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 2200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en el negocio que tiene en sociedad con su padre, pues comenta se acerca la fechas de siembra de semillas para un nueva producción.
texts.en:
Celso, 41, is hardworking and wants to succeed. He is single and lives in a rented house and shares expenses with four friends. Celso grows vegetables on his father's land to later sell at the local market. He has been able to pay his expenses through this work for the past seven years. He likes working with his father in a family business since he feels he is helping them while earning an income to meet his own expenses. He's not pleased when pests and disease attack the harvest, but he hires workers to look for and control any damage to the crops. He is an experienced cook and plans to open a restaurant in the city with his profits.

This will be his fourth loan cycle with MFP, and he is pleased and grateful for the financing for his business. He is happy to belong to his communal bank because most of the members are neighbors and all are responsible. The loan of 2200 nuevos soles will be used to invest in the business he shares with his father as the planting season approaches to ensure a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy leather to make bags, purses, and other items

loans.name: Mahounou Marcelle's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Mahounou Marcelle la responsable, âgée de 32ans, est mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé de 1an 8mois. Coiffeuse de formation, elle associe à sa formation la vente de mèches et des pommades de cheveux depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le but d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de participer aux charges de la famille. Mahounou Marcelle se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: It's a matter of a group consisting of two people in surety. Mahounou Marcelle is the leader and is 32 years old, is married and mother to one child who is 1 year and 8 months old. Hairdresser by training, she has joined to her training the sale of hair extensions and hair creams for several years. She gets her supplies in one of the markets of Bénin and from outside the country. With the goal of increasing her capital and satisfying the needs of her clientele, she requested and obtained a microloan from Finadev in order to maximize her profits and to participate in the responsibilities of the family. Mahounou Marcelle is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy 20 hair extensions and 10 hair creams.

loans.name: El Exito Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “El Éxito” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; amasandería, venta de comida rápida, venta de ropa, venta de articulos para el hogar, tejidos, venta de joyas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares.
Marta, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el quinto lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste chaleco de color blanco y blusa de color verde, su cabello lo usa tomado y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica  a la venta de carbón, desde hace 4 años. Comenta que además vende semillas de maravillas y helados, tiene un pequeño negocio establecido en su casa y trabaja de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en un negocio que se encuentra al frente de su casa encontrando la mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará carbón y semillas de maravilla.
Una de las metas de Maria es continuar con su rubro y crecer dia a dia, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 22 y 14 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral crecer con su negocio y poder vender otro tipo de mercadería además del que ya vende, y a nivel familiar darles un buen pasar a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "El Éxito" ("Success"). It is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, such as fast food, clothing, home goods, and jewelry sales, baking, knitting, and services, among others. All of the entrepreneurs belong to the city of Linares.

Maria is a member of the communal bank. In the photo above, she stands fifth from the left and is wearing a white vest and green shirt, with her dark brown hair tied up. 

She has been working in charcoal sales for the past four years. She also sells sunflower seeds and ice cream. She has a small business in her house and works from Monday to Sunday. She arranges her schedule according to her availability.

She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs from a business in front of her house at a low cost, so that it is financially convenient.

With this loan, she will buy charcoal and sunflower seeds.

One of Maria's goals is to continue in this field and grow daily, in order to generate more income and have a better quality of life. She lives with her husband and her two children, ages 14 and 22. Her dream on the business level is to grow her business and sell other types of merchandise in addition to what she currently sells. In terms of her family, her dream is to provide a good living for her family.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity to invest in her business which has been granted to her by Fondo Esperanza. She also feels very comfortable with the group, because they are united.

Linares is an important urban center in the region of Maule, located in the central area of the country. In this area, agricultural production is very important, as well as wine growing, especially for export. Some important crops are grains (rice, wheat, corn, and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard, and legumes), and fruit. Linares is the main province for the production of rice in Chile. In fact, 78% of the national rice production takes place in this province, especially in the town of Parral.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and sunflower seeds.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 63-year-old married man and father of two children.  He has worked as a journal reporter for the past 10 years.  He loves his work and is talented at what he does.  

Ibrahim is an Al Majmoua borrower (Kiva partner) of 2 cycles.  His previous loan helped him a lot to cover a family need and he was in good standing repaying the borrower.  Today, his second loan is also requested to cover a certain family need which is very important for his family members’ health.  He will make necessary home maintenance to avoid rain leakage and will also paint where necessary.  

Ibrahim is very proud and happy with his cooperation with Al Majmoua.  This is because he has a limited salary that does not afford urgent, unplanned (yet necessary) things.  Through his Al Mjamoua loans, however, he was capable of handling these.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his house.

loans.name: Kisenyi Tugonzangane Group

texts.en:
Good day dear partners! Below is the story of Rose's group. Rose is the one whose hand is raised.

Rose is a 35-year-old, married woman with eight children. Six of her children are in school. To earn a living, she operates a retail shop, where she sells pork in the outskirts of Kagadi town. Her major clients are residents of Kisenyi, a suburb of Kagadi where she operates. She explains that she started the business in 1993 in an effort to increase income for her family. Rose's major challenge is insufficient capital, which makes it difficult to meet her clients' demands for pork products.

Rose is seeking a loan in the amount of 400,000 UGX. With the loan proceeds, she plans to purchase additional piglets so that she increase her family's earnings. Her dream is to construct a permanent residential house for the family and to make sure that her children are educated at a higher institution of learning. She is thankful that UGAFODE came at the time that her group members needed financial services; indeed, she feels that UGAFODE's appearance in their lives answered their prayers. The group collectively believes that they will make good use of the money this Christmas and that the returns will be signficant.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional piglets that she will raise and slaughter for pork

loans.name: Salud Group

texts.es: Doña Esteberta tiene 46 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Salud, es madre soltera de una hija, es una mujer trabajadora con muchas aspiraciones de salir adelante para seguir apoyando a su hija y a sus nietos. Ella inicio su negocio desde hace tres años cuando trabajaba en una cafetería y decidió emprender una actividad por su propia cuenta arriesgándose a enfrentar todos los retos y desafíos, en la actualidad tiene una cafetería la cual atiende ella sola y su horario de atención al cliente comienza desde las 7:00 am y culmina a las 8:00 pm. La desventaja de doña Esteberta es que tiene que pagar alquiler de local. El préstamo que ella esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de productos para elaborar sus golosinas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para su familia. Su meta para su negocio es poder tener su propio local y ya no seguir alquilando, su sueño es tener su propia casa. Doña Esteberta ha recibido el apoyo de FAMA durante 6 ciclos los cuales los ha cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Esteberta, 46, belongs to Grupo Solidario Salud and is the single mother of a daughter. She is hardworking and wants to succeed so that she can keep helping her daughter and grandchildren. She started her business three years ago while working at a cafeteria; she decided to go out on her own and risk the challenges ahead.

She now manages her cafeteria by herself, working from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm. Paying rent for the space is a disadvantage for Esteberta. She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients to make candies. The loan will allow her to keep supporting her family. Her business goal is to own her space and not rent; her dream is to own a house. This is Esteberta's sixth loan cycle with FAMA, and she has made her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make candies.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 40 years old and married with four school-aged children. For more than five years, she has been engaged in a food vending business and she sells home-cooked food to customers. She also runs an electronic-load business. 

Wilma is requesting a loan to buy additional ingredients for her business such as vegetables, meat, seasonings, and cooking oil. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as vegetables, meat, seasonings, and cooking oil

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy de 42 años de edad, vive en una comunidad que combina espacios productivos formales e informales,  con la vida social del barrio,  conformado por edificaciones y viviendas, muchas de ellas construidas con el apoyo del estado nacional, donde habitan un importante número de familias. Allí en medio de toda esta infraestructura,  Fredy tiene 16 años de realizar una actividad comercial,  mediante la cual vende calzado, juguetería y además tiene una fotocopiadora, con la que ofrece el servicio de fotocopiaje,  directamente al consumidores ubicado en los alrrededores de su barrio y especialmente  en el sector donde habita. Sus ventas las realiza de contado, así como sus compras, por las cuales gana descuentos cuando lo hace en mayores volúmenes. Se acercan las fiestas navideñas y de noche buena, época en la que el consumo de las familias aumenta,  pues hay mucho dinero circulante. Para Fredy comprar en el volumen que responda a su demanda, se vuelve todo un desafío, por eso acude a un credkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado juguetes, que su clientela le ha encargado, para ser entregados como aguinaldos a sus hijos, en la noche del 24 de Diciembre,  día del nacimiento de Jesús. Su meta es aumentar sus ingresos y es por ella que se levanta diariamente con mucho ánimo para cumplirla y llenarse de felicidad.
texts.en:
Fredy is 42 years old and lives in a community that combines formal and informal activities with the social life of the neighborhood, made up of building and homes, many of them constructed with the help of the federal government, home to a great number of families.

There in the middle of this infrastructure, Fredy has been in business for 16 years, selling shoes, toys and he owns a photocopier, offering photocopying services, directly to consumers located around his neighborhood and especially in the area where he lives.

He buys and sells in cash, and so he gets a higher discount when buying in larger quantities. The Christmas and New Year holiday season is approaching, a season when families spend more, so there is a lot of money in circulation.

Fredy buys in volume to meet the demand and it becomes a challenge which is why he is asking for a Kiva loan, his first financial arrangement through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy with cash toys that his customers have ordered as Christmas presents to be given to their children on the night of the 24th of December, the birthday of Jesus. His goal is to increase his income and this is why he gets up every day with a lot of enthusiasm to carry on and fill it with happiness.

loans.use: to buy toys with cash to sell to his customers who have ordered Christmas presents for their children.

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjollca is a 45-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have two adult children.

She explains that she is an experienced businesswoman. Specifically, she sells various women's clothing. She started her business 20 years ago, and she depends on her husband to help transport clothes for the business. Her business is profitable and has been running smoothly. With the income she earns, she helps her family pay their household expenses. She makes new friends while running her business, which serves to increase her customer base.

For the first time Vjollca is requesting a loan in the amount of 1300 EUR in order to buy dolls/mannequins to display her clothes. She is counting on this loan to help her reach her goals. With the loan proceeds, she expects to increase her income. She promises to be punctual in making her loan payments.

loans.use: To buy dolls for exposure clothes

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo lives with her husband and two children who are four and eight years old. She works selling and tailoring clothing. Mwanakombo works with her husband to support her family and has been working almost every day for the past ten years. Mwanakombo also sells a few items such as tea leaves, snacks, and coconuts and her plan is to open a kiosk soon.

Mwanakombo is requesting a loan to buy wholesale fabric to make clothing to sell. She will also use her loan to buy supplies such as zippers, buttons, and thread to help in her work. Christmas and New Year are approaching and this increases demand. Her loan will allow her to take advantage of this. In the future, Mwanakombo’s dream is to earn a higher business income during the end-of-year festivities to have more comfort.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies such as zippers, buttons, and thread

loans.name: Rasmia

texts.en:
Rasmia is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Faraj appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured on the family's land.

Rasmia is a 32-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs.

For the past six years, Rasmia and the rest of her family have been working in the agricultural sector. Specifically, they have a piece of land, where they cultivate different types of peas and vegetables. They sells their crops at the market, which has been a profitable project and a second source of income for the family.

However, the business needs support to cover some necessary costs. As a result, Rasmia is requesting a loan from FATEN in the amount of $1,500 to help her cover the cost of purchasing peas and vegetable seedlings, which she plans on cultivating during the winter season. The loan proceeds should help Rasmia and her family grow better crops; in turn, she expects their sales to increase and their living conditions to improve.

loans.use: To expand and improve her farming business by purchasing additional seasonal seedlings

loans.name: Ranchería Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Ranchería” está integrado por cuatro mujeres muy trabajadoras, son personas que habitan en una zona mazahua donde sus costumbres aún son muy notorias, como sus trajes típicos e incluso el idioma. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellas mismas porque donde viven solía ser un rancho que llevaba la palabra "Ranchería" en su nombre. 
Doña Yolanda quien es la representate de la comunidad platica que tiene 35 años de edad es una mujer casada desde hace 14 años con el señor Alejandro quien trabaja como albañil; juntos han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales van a la escuela. Doña Yolanda se dedica a la crianza de borregos desde hace 20 años, en casa tiene 8 borregos pero con el crédito piensa comprar 4 más y zacate que servirá como alimento para los animales. La señora Yolanda comento “Inicie con la crianza de los borregos porque desde niña mi mamá me enseño a cuidarlos, criarlos y verlos que son una manera de tener algo de dinero”. Doña Yolanda es una persona muy sonriente esta muy contenta porque gracias  a sus ganancias le han ayudado a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Solo que su única dificultad por la cual atraviesa es cuando sus borregos enferman y llegan a morir para Yolanda es una pérdida de ganancias ella nunca ha recibido una capacitación de como cuidar sus borregos pero esta segura que cuando mas enferman sus animalitos es cuando hace mucho frio por eso es cuando trata de cuidarlos más para que el numero de sus borregos no disminuya y así mismo sus ganancias serán más, esto le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y mejorar la educación de sus hijas para que puedan tener una carrera profesional. Doña Yolanda y las demás integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas por el crédito ya que gracias a este podrán comprar mas animalitos como los borregos.
texts.en:
The group, "Ranchería" is made up of four hardworking women, who live in an area where their Mazahua customs and language still have a very noticeable presence. Typical dress and the native language are still very common. The women chose this group name because where they live used to be a ranch called "Ranchería". 

Doña Yolanda, who is the group's representative, is 35 years old. She has been married for 14 years to Alejandro, who works in construction. They have three school-aged children. Doña Yolanda, for the last 20 years, has made a living raising sheep. She owns eight sheep and with this loan, she plans to buy four more, as well as feed for them. 

Doña Yolanda mentions that "I began raising sheep because as a young girl, I learned from my mother how to take care of them and raise them. I saw that this was a good way to make money." Doña Yolanda is a very warm and happy person because thanks to her earnings from this work, she has been able to help improve her family's quality of life. The only obstacle she's faced so far has been disease among the animals, which sometimes kills her sheep, causing her to lose income. Though she has never received any formal training in raising sheep,  she is sure that when it is colder, more of her animals get sick. She is trying to take better care of her animals, so that she doesn't lose any more and so she will be able to earn more income to help her improve her family's quality of life. She hopes to give her daughters a better education so that they will be able to have professional careers.

Doña Yolanda and the other members of this group are very grateful for this loan since it will help them buy more small animals like sheep.

loans.use: to buy four sheep and feed.

loans.name: Enhmaa

texts.en:
Enhmaa is 45 years old and a widow who lives with her daughter in a small house in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband passed away August 2012. Her husband used to drive a minivan as a public transportation service and she worked as a conductor. Her daughter Hulan, age 24, has graduated from university and just started a clothing retail business at a rental counter of a local shopping center. Their family business stopped because of their loss of their loving husband and father. 

Enhmaa is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to restart her husband's business as a public transportation provider and to repair their minivan to run the business. She is a strong, hardworking, and welcoming woman who also has a good history on her previous loan repayments.

Picture of borrower is in her daughter's clothes retail store in local shopping center.

loans.use: to restart her husband's business as a public transportation provider and to repair their minivan to run the business

loans.name: Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
El comité Superpoderosas nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Zunilda es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, y comenta que está  creciendo en su negocio gracias al apoyo que está recibiendo de su grupo y de la fundación. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que sueña con superar todos los obstáculos que tiene para que pueda seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y haciendo todas las prendas hermosas que confecciona. Zunilda agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Superpoderosas Communal Bank in the city of San Lorenzo came about through the management and the support of a group of women working in that place.  The main goal of the members is for each one of them to grow personally and professionally.

Zunilda's a member of this group.  She earns a living sewing, and she comments that she's growing in her business thanks to the support she's receiving from her group and the foundation.  She's a very hardworking person who dreams of overcoming all her obstacles so she can continue helping her family.

She's requesting this loan to buy fabric to continue working and making all her beautiful garments.

Zunilda's grateful for the help she's receiving because it's going to be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest port (Freeport) in Liberia. She is a 41-year-old, single mother of four children. Her children are between the ages of 7 and 20 years old, and they attend school and live at home.

To earn a living, for the past ten years she has been operating a market table, where she sells goods/foods such as rice, beans, oil, and cassava. She says her main challenge is the rainy season. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned sales techniques and skills from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it allows her to generate income, which benefits her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, beans, oil, and cassava for her business. In the future she wants to send her children to quality colleges.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (rice, beans, oil, cassava, etc.) for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, salt, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: Este es Grupo “Dios es amor” que conforman 08 mujeres emprendedoras que pasan al ciclo 30. Alejandra tiene 47 años, madre soltera con 04 hijos de la cual 02 de ellos en etapa escolar, forma parte de la directiva y es la que preside al Grupo. Alejandra se dedica hace 2 años a la venta de artefactos en el mercado. Alejandra ha solicitado el préstamo para la compra de calculadoras, parlantes, USB, mp3. Su sueño es de ampliar y hacer crecer más su negocio para poder atender mejor a sus clientes.Gracias al préstamo que le brinda Kiva puede seguir mejorando su negocio. Alejandra se encuentra ubicada adelante es la tercera del lado derecho, viste polo rojo con chompa morada.
texts.en:
The eight enterprising members of the communal bank “Dios es amor” are in their 30th loan cycle. Alejandra, 47, is the single mother of four children, two of whom are students, and is the group's president and a member of its board. She has been selling electronic devices in the market for the past two years. 

Alejandra is applying for a loan to buy calculators, speakers, USBs, and mp3 players. She dreams of expanding and growing her business to give her customers better service. Her Kiva loan lets her keep improving her business. In the photo, Alejandra is the third person from the right and is wearing a red shirt and purple sweater.

loans.use: to buy calculators, speakers, USBs, and mp3 players.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 48 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport in Liberia.  She is married and has seven children, ranging in age from 12 to 30 years old.  Two children are working and living on their own while the remaining 5 live at home and attend school.

For the past 23 years she has been running a market table where she sells dry fish.   She started this business with money given to her by her husband.  The business helps her save more money.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish for her business.   Her plans are to build a house and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en: Salem is 29 years old and from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2010. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a display refrigerator and more goods for the store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator and more goods for the store

loans.name: Maritina

texts.en:
Maritina is a 38-year-old businesswoman, married to Boniface, and they are blessed with children. She operates a mobile money transfer business (Mpesa) with a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings, which she uses to support her family. 

Maritina is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing client. Maritina will use the loan together with her savings to open another Mobile Money transfer outlet (Mpesa) in another part of the town. With the anticipated profit from the business she will invest back into the business and also buy a motorcycle for family use. 

Her dreams are to have healthy, educated children and a stable business with good income to support her family comfortably.

loans.use: to open another Mobile Money transfer outlet (Mpesa).

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya de 18 años de edad, es una joven mujer, carismática, luchadora con ganas de superación. Es soletera, vive junto a su mama por quienes se esfuerza por darle lo mejor y ver que no les falte nada. Vive en su casa propia lo cual construyo con la ayuda de su querida madre. El trabajo que realiza Cinthya es costura, cose ropas de diferentes variedades para todo tipo de ocasión, lo cual lo realiza en su casa  propia en un ambiente que acondicionó especialmente para la exhibición de sus trabajos terminados. 
Se inició con esta actividad gracias a que estudió en un centro de educación ocupacional, invirtió su propio capital para pagar su matrícula, ella sabía que la inversión le  daría muchas  satisfacciones, aprendió e invirtió su capital comprando máquinas de costura y materiales  para empezar con esa actividad.
Esta actividad la viene realizando hace más de 02 años, tiempo que le  sirvió para hacerse conocida por la calidad de su costura, y cada día aumenta el número de clientes quienes la recomiendan con otras personas. 
Considera rentable a esta actividad ya que puede ayudar a su mamá con los gastos del hogar.
Comenta que antes de empezar con esta actividad tenía muchos problemas económicos, espera seguir creciendo y ampliar más su negocio y convertirse en una empresaria de costura. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 02 con la MFP, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzara con su negocio y se convertirá en una gran empresaria. Por otro lado nos comenta que está muy contenta por ser parte de un grupo responsable. Con el préstamo solicitado de 600 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, blondas entre otras. Para tener un stock disponible de materiales, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera aumentar su margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Cinthya is 18 years old. She is a young woman, charismatic, and struggling to get ahead. She is single and lives with her mother striving to give her the best so that they lack nothing.

She lives in her own home which was built with the help of her dear mother. Cinthya works as a seamstress. She makes different kinds of clothing for all types of occasions, from her own home in a facility fitted out especially to display the finished work.

She started this business thanks to studies through a vocational education center. She used her own capital to pay for her studies. She knew that the investment would give her a lot of satisfaction. She learned and invested her capital buying sewing machines and supplies to begin her work.

She has been doing this for more than two years, and she has become known during this time for the quality of her sewing, and each day she increases the number of customers who recommend her to other people. She considers it to be profitable as she can help her mother with the household expenses.

She says that before she started this business she had many financial problems. She is hoping to continue growing and to expand her business more to to open a tailoring business, which is the reason for her second loan through MFP. She is very happy to be able to have the financial support that she has been receiving, as her business advances and she becomes a large business. She comments that she is very happy to be a part of a responsible group.

With the requested loan of 600 soles, she will buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, lace and more. In order to have an available stock of supplies, she is searching for lower prices by buying in volume, in order to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy fabric, elastic, thread, needles, and scissors to be used in her business

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 20-year-old shopkeeper. He is single and a very hardworking young man who has been running the retail shop for the past 10 months with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings. 

Denis is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing Kadet customer. Denis will use the loan to add stock of sugar, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc. to his shop. With the anticipated profit, he plans to reinvest in the business. 

Denis dreams of expanding his retail shop.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Madia

texts.en: Madia is 33 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport in Liberia.  She is married to a church pastor and they have 3 children between the ages of 4 and 17 years old.  For the past five years she has been selling fabric in one of the well-known markets located in Congo Town.  She likes her business because she has many customers and makes more profit.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fabric (traditional cloth) for her business.  She hopes to buy land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric (traditional cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter, de 38 años de edad, es un hombre con muchas ganas de trabajar y decidido a salir adelante por su familia. Es conviviente con María quien comerciante y madre de sus 2 hijos de 14 y 06 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos viven en su casa propia en compañía de su mamá. La actividad que tiene Walter es la venta de repuestos y servicio de taller para motos, para eso cuenta con una tienda multiservicio instalado en un local que tiene alquilado, donde atiende los pedidos de sus clientes que le confían la reparación de sus vehículos, brindándoles un buen servicio y los repuestos nuevos que necesiten.
Se inició hace más de 10 años con un capital propio, comprando y vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades luego aumentando su stock de mercaderías con las ganancias que obtenía y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su pareja en el servicio del taller. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene estos productos pues la zona donde está ubicada su tienda es bastante comercial y transitada.
Decidiéndose a empezar con su negocio pues ya lo tenía como proyecto en su vida. Esta actividad económica fue una iniciativa de su pareja quien la animo para aumentar sus ingresos y no pasar necesidades, buscando brindar una mejor calidad de visa a sus hijos.
Por tanto viendo el buen resultado que sigue teniendo, desea comprar la casa donde alquila su local, así ahorrarse gastos de alquiler,  también  abrir otra sucursal para ver crecer su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP.  Espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta estar a gusto con banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y colaborador.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de lubricantes para su tienda en cajas al por mayor, buscando precios más bajos, así obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Walter, 38 years old, is a man with a great desire to work and is dedicated to moving his family forward. He lives with María, who is a merchant and the mother of their two children who are 14 and 6 years old. He loves them very much. They live together in their own home, along with his mother. Walter sells spare parts and services vehicles, so he has a multi-service shop located in a building that he rents. Here, he attends to the requests of his customers, who count on him to repair their vehicles. He provides good service and the new parts that they need.

He began over 10 years ago with his own capital by buying and selling in small quantities. Then, he would increase his stock of merchandise from his earnings. Currently, he also counts on help from his partner in the shop. He considers his business to be pretty successful due to the income he makes and the demand for his products. His shop is located in a busy, commercial area.

Deciding to start a business was one of Walter's goals in life. This economic activity was a venture of his partner's, who he encouraged to increase income and not overlook necessities. They hoped to obtain a better quality of life for their children.

Due to the good results that they continue to have, Walter wants to buy the house where he rents his shop so that he can save on rental expenses. He also wants to open another branch to grow his business. Therefore, this will be his fourth loan with MFP. He hopes to have their support in order to continue with his goals. He also mentions that he is pleased with the communal bank because he considers it a united and collaborative group.

With the amount of 1200 nuevo soles that Walter has requested, he will invest in buying wholesale lubricants in boxes for his store, looking for the cheapest prices so that he can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale lubricants in boxes for his store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 42 years old and a high school dropout.  She is married to a businessman and has seven children between the ages of 11 and 24.  The children live at home and attend school.  For the past two years she has been running a shop where she sells various items such as charcoal, bread, and milk.  Sometimes she has fewer customers but most of the time she makes a lot of money.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more items for her business.  In the future, she plans to send her children through college.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her business (charcoal, bread, milk, etc.).

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Paz y Bien” que conforman 08 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 10. Este es el caso de una de los socios Eduardo de 24 años, soltero, forma parte de la directiva y es la que preside al Grupo. Hace 03 años que Eduardo inicio su propio negocio de la venta de ceviche en un puesto y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Su sueño es de ampliar más su negocio y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Solicito el crédito para la compra de una cocina industrial de 02 hornillas y pescado. Eduardo está muy contento con este préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas Kiva. Eduardo se encuentra en la parte de atrás es el tercero del lado derecho, viste polo verde.
texts.en:
This is Paz y Bien Group, made up of eight members in their tenth cycle who make a living in a variety of business activities.  This is the case of Eduardo, one of the members.  He's 24 years old and single, and he presides over the board of directors.

Three years ago Eduardo started his own business selling ceviche in a stall, and he has loyal customers.  His dream is to expand his business more and be able to better serve his customers.

He requested the loan to buy an industrial stove with two burners and fish. 

Eduardo's very happy about this loan and thanks the Kiva lenders.

Eduardo's the third from the right in the back, wearing a green polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy fish and an industrial stove

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
Emanuel,  es el excelente grupo de mujeres de la ciudad de Itá, el que se formo gracias a que  se contactaron con la asesora en una de las visitas por la zona, el grupo tiene 19 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Nancy, miembro de este grupo, se dedica a la confección, ella es modista hace ya un tiempo, y gracias al trabajo arduo que hace está saliendo adelante. Es una excelente persona que pese a ciertos obstáculos está saliendo adelante. Su meta es poder tener un gran taller de costura y también poder dar trabajo a otras personas de su barrio, ya que sabe que es difícil ahora.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones, cierres y demás, para poder usarlo en su taller y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
"Emanuel" is the excellent women's group from the city of Itá that formed thanks to getting in contact with the advisor on one of her visits to the area. The group has 19 women who find themselves on their fourth loan cycle, working comfortably together and supporting each other within the program.

Nancy, a member of this group, earns her living sewing. She has been a dressmaker for a while, and thanks to her hard work, she is making progress. She is an excellent person who, despite certain obstacles, is getting ahead. Her goal is to be able to have a large sewing workshop and to be able to provide jobs to other people in her neighborhood, because she knows that this is a difficult time.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, and more, so that she can use them in her workshop and continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, and more.

loans.name: Henrik

texts.en:
Henrik is 59 years old. He lives with his wife, son, and daughter in Yerevan, Armenia. Henrik is working at State Armenian University as an usher. Henrik's wife is a teacher and works in one of Yerevan's secondary schools. Henrik’s daughter is a student at State Armenian Engineering University in the department of energy. Henrik's son studies in "Microsoft Innovation Center of Armenia" in the courses of "NET."
   
Henrik’s children are not working, so Henrik and his wife provide for all of the family's needs and expenses. Henrik needs a 200,000 AMD loan to pay for his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for his children's tuition fees

loans.name: Ephys

texts.en: Ephys runs a private service vehicle business.  His wife, kids, and business are doing well.  He is now applying for his second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He plans to use this new loan to service his vehicles, as they are due.  With the profits he earns from his business, he plans to educate his children and to expand his dairy farm.  His dreams are to buy a piece of land and construct a permanent house in his hometown.

loans.use: to service his vehicles.

loans.name: Ecole Don Bosco Group

texts.fr: Le client Prince est un enseignant dans une école Don Bosco, âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants, qui étudient tous. Ce client s’est déjà lancé dans le projet de petit commerce de poissons. Elle s’entraide avec son épouse dans ces activités commerciales. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de renforcer son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 5 sacs de poissons (salés et fumés). Ce client regrette la dégradation et le développement de l’insécurité dans la province et qui a des effets collatéraux, surtout négatifs sur ses projets. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit pendant cette période de crise, alors que les autres institutions financières ont déjà stoppé l’octroie de crédit.
texts.en: The client Prince is a teacher in a Don Bosco school. He is 35 years old, married and father to 3 children, who all study. This client already went into business in a project of a small shop selling fish. He is helped in this commercial business by his spouse. Thus, this new loan will serve to strengthen his turnover by buying 5 bags of fish (salted and smoked). This client regrets the deterioration and the development of insecurity in the province which has collateral effects, especially negative for projects. In the end, he thanks Hekima for its support in micro loans during this period of crisis, while other financial institutions already stopped granting credit.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of fish (salted and smoked).

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño Jesus se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Todas ellas son madres de familia que luchan por salir adelante.
Maria es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, dice que le está yendo muy bien y que sus ventas están mejorando ya que el carbón es muy utilizado, pues el gas es muy caro. Empezó con muy poco sus ventas, al principio tenía pocas ventas, pero hoy, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y creciendo y cada vez le va mejor.
Está pidiendo de este crédito para la compra de más carbón, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y seguir teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The committee Divino Niño Jesus was formed by several neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The members made a group that was very united and capable of taking on activities together that strengthen their camaraderie. They are all mothers in families that are fighting to advance. Maria is part of this group. She works selling coal. She says that it is going very well and that her sales are increasing because coal is widely-used and because gas is very expensive. Starting out, she had few sales, but today, thanks to her work and efforts, she is progressing and growing and it is better and better for her. She is asking for this loan to buy more coal. With this purchase, she can keep working and have the means to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy coal to sell.

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Las Brisas” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de pan amasado, venta de mote con huesillo (bebida típica chilena para la temporada de verano), peluquería, venta de productos para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Monica, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al medio de la foto, viste una polera de color beige, blue jeans, cartera de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica  al a venta de helados y semillas de  maravilla, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa de lunes a domingo y de preferencia trabaja en la tarde.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en distribuidoras que se especializan en ventas de helados al por mayor a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará semillas de maravilla y helados.
Una de las metas de Mónica es crecer dia dia en su negocio y tener un local más grande donde pueda a tender a su clientela de manera tranquila y vender más cosas.
Monica vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 16 y 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral tener un local mas grande, y a nivel familiar darles un buen pasar a sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called Las Brisas, is made up of 21 entrepreneurs who are involved in different businesses, such as the sale of clothing, homemade bread, “mote con huesillo” (a traditional Chilean summer-time drink), hairdressing, home product sales and services, among others. All of the members come from the city of Talca.

Monica is the member of the communal bank who is seen standing in the middle of the photo, dressed in a beige top and blue jeans and holding a black purse. She has dark chestnut hair, which she wears loose.

Monica has been selling ice cream and “semillas de maravilla” (sunflower seeds), She works at home from Mondays to Sundays, preferably in the afternoons. She buys the merchandise she needs from distributors who specialize in selling ice cream wholesale at a low cost, so that it is economically feasible. She will use the loan to purchase sunflower seeds and ice cream.

One of Monica’s goals is to expand her business day by day and to have a larger place where she can comfortably wait on her customers and increase her sales.

Monica lives with her husband and two children, who are 16 and 9 years old. Her dreams relative to her business are to have a larger venue and with regard to her family are to provide a good life for her children. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza is giving her to invest in her business.

Monica notes that she has very good communication with the members of her communal bank and that the training workshops have helped her learn new sales strategies and bookkeeping.

Talca is part of the Maule region, located in the center of the country. It constitutes the administrative, economical and cultural center of the region and is the most important city of Chile’s Valle Central. In Chile, Talca is referred to in the curious phrase: “Talca, Paris and London.” Some say that the phrase is a derivation of the saying, originally in English, that “Talca is like London” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in the winter, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to purchase sunflower seeds and ice cream.

loans.name: Mba'apora Group

texts.es:
El comité Mba'apora  se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Son mujeres jefas de familia, que han visto una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias, y es por eso que se unieron para salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Emerita es miembro de este grupo, ella vende helados desde hace un tiempo y dice que está creciendo gracias a su trabajo y su sacrificio. Gracias a la venta de sus helados está ayudando a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones El sueño de ella es poder seguir creciendo e invertir más en su negocio para poder dando lo mejor a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de helados de muchos sabores, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder tener un stock bien surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee "Mba'apora" was formed out of a number of neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. They are women who are heads of household who have seen a great opportunity for them and their families, which is why they got together in order to move forward and help their families. 

Emerita is a member of this group. She sells ice cream, which she has been doing for a while, and says that it is growing thanks to her work and sacrifice. Thanks to the sale of ice cream she is helping her family and gives them everything they need to live their lives without deprivation. Her dream is to be able to continue growing and invest more in her business in order to to be able to give her family the best. 

She is seeking this loan to purchase ice cream in many flavors since hot weather is coming up and she wants to be well-stocked with products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en: Jaafar is a 26-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and lives with his one parent and sibling. He is trying his best to bring added income to the family and enhance their way of living. He started working as a blacksmith a few years ago. He learned this profession from many years of experience and is doing the best he can to better improve and develop himself. Despite his tough work tasks, Jaafar does not complain. And as he wants to enlarge his business and grow his work,  he decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed metal supplies to carry on his work in a proper way.  He wishes to get married and have children. These are the reasons why he’s in a real need to amplify his income in order to be able to make the needed savings for his wedding and his future life plans.

loans.use: to purchase metal supplies

loans.name: Banco Mujer Shekhinná Group

texts.es:
Doña Hilda es la presidenta de Banco Mujer SheKhinná , con 38 años, es madre de 4 hijos y vive hace mas de 21 años con su compañero.  Ambos son agricultores y trabajan en una pequeña parcela propia, donde realizan actividades agropecuarias.  Ella dedica a la cría de pollos y su esposo se encarga de los cultivos. Estas actividades son las que generan ingresos para cubrir lo gastos básicos de la familia. Este es su tercer segundo crédito y el plan de inversión es la compra de pollos, alimentos, concentrados y vitaminas.
Doña Hilda busca aumentar sus ingresos mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y poder enviar a sus hijos a estudiar. Junto a Doña Hilda integran el grupo 6 socias mas que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias y comerciales.
texts.en:
Doña Hilda is the president of Banco Mujer SheKhinná. At 38 years of age she is the mother of four children and has lived with her partner for over 21 years. They are both farmers and work on a small plot of land of their own where they carry out agricultural activities. She devotes herself to raising chickens and her husband is responsible for the crops. These are the activities by which they generate income for covering the basic necessities of the family. This is their second or third loan and they plan to invest in the purchase of chickens, feed, concentrate and vitamins. 

Doña Hilda seeks to increase her earnings to improve her family's quality of life and to be able to send her children away to school. Along with Doña Hilda the group is made up of six other members who will invest in agricultural and commercial activities.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, animal feed, concentrates and vitamins.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a Lebanese single man. He’s 21 years old. He’s really attached to his parents and two siblings who are both working. Cooperating together, Hussein and his family are capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. He started his business at an early age. He had to work really hard to take some responsibilities off his father. He has been working as a car mechanic in his own garage and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. He also visits them at their locations in case of big damages. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge his business and buy new mechanic tools. He wishes to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems and he believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy new mechanic's tools

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a 30-year-old married man and father of three children.  He has been working in electronics repair for 14 years.  As with other Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, he has to start work early to help his family in their living. 

Chadi started his own business in 2007 and is thankful for what he has.  He likes his work a lot and has broad experience.  This is Chadi's fourth cycle borrowing from Al Majmoua.  He states that the previous loans helped him a lot in supporting his business and increasing his income.

In addition to the maintenance he does, he also sells satellite receivers and many other electrical items.  He hopes to continue expanding his business, to remain capable of raising his children in a suitable manner, and to providing them with the best education ever.  Today he is applying for a youth loan in order to buy special electronics.  He intends to use the spare parts to make requested maintenance.

loans.use: to buy special electronics for spare parts.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife. They have two children attending school. He was working nights and days to be able to manage his family’s expenses and his business operations. Abdallah owns a small minimarket where he sells all kinds of dairy and daily products. He also sells gifts and toys to supplement his income.  He’s well known for being kind and friendly to his clients. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions in addition to a diverse quantity of toys and souvenirs. In that way, he will be able to increase his revenues, thus improving his way of living. He looks forward to expanding his grocery, waiting for the perfect time to open other branches and assign people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions, toys and souveniers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 43 years old and lives in Congo Town.  She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 26.  All of them attend school.  For the past 18 years she has been operating a small shop where she sells charcoal and soap.  Sometimes she has fewer customers but most of the time she make a lot of profit.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, soap, and other items.  In the future she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, soap, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 38-year-old businessman who has been selling motorcycle spare parts for the past two years.  He is married to his wife, Daisy, and they are blessed with one child.  He has a monthly income of 30,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing customer. Edward will use the loan to stock motorcycle spare parts in his shop.  With the anticipated income from the business he plans to open another shop for motorcycle spare parts.  His future dreams are to give a better quality education to his children and to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia, a 33-year-old business lady, is married to Simon and the mother of four children. She has been running a boutique shop for the past two years, earning a monthly income of Kes 50,000.

Tersia is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by an existing customer. She plans to use it to purchase more new clothes such as ladies' dresses, blouses, etc. to maximize her profits during this festive season. She will use those profits to educate her children.

Her future dreams are to own a big boutique shop in Thika Town.

loans.use: To purchase more new clothes like ladies' dresses, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is undoubtedly an admirable person. She always has a smile and she is characterized by her happiness. She is described as a patient, humble, and hard-working person. She puts a lot of trust in her work and her desire to get ahead. She loves her entire family and works hard to see them always happy. She runs a cosmetic shop and a boutique.

The loan Mwanasiti is requesting is from Yehu Microfinance Trust. With it, she will buy cosmetics, like perfumes, body creams, and facial creams. For Mwanasiti, this is a way to continue moving forward and to help her family; it is an opportunity for personal and familial growth. It is for this reason that Mwanasiti is very joyful in her work and desires to better the quality of life for her whole family.
